loans.name: Evelin Yamileth

texts.es:
Evelyn, es casada, tiene dos hijos, de su madre aprendió a trabajar para generar ingreso, se dedica a atender su negocio de pupusas y productos de revistas, lo hace sin ninguna dificultad desde hace cinco años. Se esfuerza para apoyar con los gastos de su hogar.
Invertirá en la compra de quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, harina, bebidas y productos de revista, para que su negocio este lo suficientemente surtido y así ofrecerlos a sus clientes, espera aumentar su clientela. Mejorar sus ventas y generar ingresos que necesita para cancelar la deuda.
Sueña con tener un negocio más amplio que sea rentable para dar a su familia una mejor alimentación, salud y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Evelyn is married and has two children. She learned how to work to make money from her mother. She works taking care of her pupusa (a local fast food) and magazine business. She has done this with no major difficulty for 5 years.  She makes an effort to help with the household expenses. Evelyn will invest this loan purchasing cheese, pork cracklings, oil, flour, drinks and magazines. Then her business will be well stocked with a sufficient variety to offer her clients. She hopes to increase her clientele, sales and generate the revenue needed to pay off her loan. She dreams of having a bigger business that is profitable to offer her family better food, health and education for her children.

loans.use: to buy cheese, pork cracklings, oil, flour, drinks and magazines.

loans.name: Santos Ovidio

texts.es: Don Santos, tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos, y vive con sus hijos y nietos en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. En busca de obtener un ingreso para su familia ha establecido una pulpería donde vende refrescos, churros, verduras, granos básicos, azúcar, productos de limpieza, harina, huevos, pastas, etc. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 1 años luego de haber dejado de trabajar en una compañía azucarera. El solicita 5,000 Lempiras para comprar manteca, pollo, refrescos, churros, harina, etc. para surtir el negocio y mejorar las ventas. Sus planes son comprar un terreno para dejarle herencia a sus hijos y tener un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Santos is 52 years old, married and has 6 children. He lives with his children and grandchildren in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Searching for a way to generate income for his family he opened a small store where he sells drinks, churros, vegetables, basic grains, sugar, cleaning products, flour, eggs, pasta, etc. He has run this business for one year after stopping his employment at a sugar company.

Santos is requesting a loan of 5,000 HNL to buy lard, chicken, soft drinks, churros, flour, etc. to stock his store and increase sales. His plans are to buy some land to leave as an inheritance for his children and to operate a good business.

loans.use: to stock his business with products like lard, chicken, soft drinks, churros, flour, etc.

loans.name: Lydialyn

texts.en:
Lydialyn is a married woman, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lydialyn is 34 years old and has four children who are in school.

Lydialyn has a direct-selling personal collection products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional personal collection products to sell, like detergent soap, bath soap, body spray, and lotion.

Lydialyn has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal collection productst to sell, like detergent soap, bath soap, body spray, and lotion.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 54 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Florita has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years, and also earns an income from rice retail.

Florita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one compressor for painting, one polishing machine to drill into walls, and one soldering machine.

loans.name: Jessi

texts.es: Jessi, de 34 años, es una mujer amable y buena, está casada con Marcial y junto a él tiene 3 hijos de 16, 9 y 3 años de edad respectivamente, tiene su casa propia sin embargo ahora vive en la casa de su suegra. Trabaja arduamente para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia. El trabajo de Jessi consiste en la venta de frutas regionales, entre los productos que vende encontramos: plátano, yuca, cocona, hojas de “bijao”, limones y otros. Cada producto lo vende en mayor cantidad dependiendo de su temporada de producción ya que alguno de ellos puede escasear en ciertos meses o en caso contrario pueden abundar. Tiene un puesto de ventas en uno de los principales mercados de la ciudad y debido a esa concurrencia de la población logra vender mucho durante el día. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad cerca de 5 años y desde que empezó lo ha hecho sola. Le gusta mucho su forma de trabajo ya que se siente libre e independiente, además gana muy bien y eso le permite estar mas tranquila aun, su meta principal es expandir su negocio y empezar a vender sus productos al por mayor enviando a otras ciudades ya que afirma que de esa forma sus ingresos económicos aumentarán considerablemente. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1600, es una socia muy responsable y solidaria dentro de su grupo, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de plátano, cocona y naranjas para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en:
Jessi, 34 years old, is a very friendly woman. She is married to Marcial and together they have three children who are 16, 9 and 3 years old. They have their own home but are currently living with Jessi's mother in law. Jessi works very hard to provide her family with a better quality of life. Jessi works selling regional fruits, including bananas, yucca, coconuts, banana leaves, limes and others. The quantity of each fruit that she sells depends on the season, since there are times of the year when some of these products are scarce and others when they are plentiful. Jessi has a market stall in one of the city's main markets, and given the number of people who attend this market each day she has strong sales. She has had this business for 5 years, and has worked alone the whole time. She really enjoys her work since she feels free and independent, and since she earns a decent living it allows her not to worry too much. 

Jessi's goal is to expand her business and begin to sell her produce in bulk in other cities. This would increase her income considerably. She is currently asking for a loan of 1,600 Soles. She is a very responsible borrower, committed to her lending group, and she is grateful to those lenders who allow her to continue developing her business. With the loan requested, she will buy more bananas, coconuts and oranges to continue her work.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas, coconuts and oranges

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en: Ma. Corazon is married and works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and has been in this business for eight years. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more clothing like shorts, blouses, t-shirts, etc. to sell. In the future, Ma. Corazon would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more clothing like shorts, blouses, and t-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena is a 45-year-old married woman with two children.

Ma. Magdalena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Ma. Magdalena has previously borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 12 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Ma. Magdalena aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria is 39 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Maria has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Roberto William

texts.es:
Roberto, invertirá la compra insecticidas, abono, fertilizantes y pagara el alquilar del terreno, para seguir sembrando maíz, plátano y pipián, para tener una cosecha más abundante e incrementar sus ganancias.
Con el crédito anterior compro los insumos agrícolas necesarios, con los que pudo aumentar su cosecha, mejoro las ventas, su economía es más estable. Su familia mantiene el mismo núcleo, y sigue luchando para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Roberto will invest in the purchase of insecticides and fertilizers and pay to rent land so he can continue cultivating corn, plantain and pumpkin in order to have an abundant harvest and increase his earnings.

With the previous loan he bought needed farming supplies that enabled him to increase his harvest and improve sales so that his finances are more stable. His family maintains its same core and he continues striving to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides, compost, fertilizers and to pay to rent land.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is 44 years old and married. She has two children who are in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Chona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, rice, noodles, tissue, diapers, sanitary napkins, detergent soap, etc. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, rice, noodles, tissue, diapers, sanitary napkins, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Loida Eunice

texts.es:
Loyda, es casada, tienen tres hijos, vive junto su esposo y sus hijos, tiene una familia muy unida. Por la necesidad de generar ingresos y apoyar con los gastos de su familia, inicio un negocio que consiste en atender su librería que ya tiene cuatro años de poseerla y hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en su administración.
Comprará cuadernos, papelería, lapiceros, folders, etc., todo lo necesario para que el inventario de su librería este muy equipado para atender mejor a sus clientes, espera ampliar su negocio, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar  su economía.
Sueña con tener un negocio mucho más amplio, mejorar el local, y dar oportunidad a sus hijos de una educación superior.
texts.en:
Loida is married with 3 children. She lives with her husband and children and their family is very united. Due to the need to generate income and help with family expenses, she started an office supply store. She has had the store for four years already, with no problems managing it.

She will purchase notebooks, paper, writing utensils, folders, etc. - everything necessary to keep her store's inventory well stocked to better serve her customers. She hopes to expand her business, increase her sales and improve her economic situation. She dreams of having a much bigger business, improving the store and giving her children the opportunity to get a higher education.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, paper, writing utensils, folders, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools for masonry

loans.name: Rasoola Group

texts.en:
Rasoola (shown in the photo with her hand raised) is a 60 year old married woman and a mother of seven children. Her husband runs a business to buy and sell rice that he buys from fields. This business provides a valuable service to his community and clients. At this time he does not have the funds to expand his business, due to the increasing price of rice. 

Rasoola, as a member of 2-person lending group, has requested a loan to help her husband to purchase rice for his business in order to increase his earning capacity. She wishes to use part of the revenue for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy wheat and rice to sell to retailers.

loans.name: Victor's Group

texts.en:
Victor is 32 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Chemojech village in Vihiga, Kenya. Chemojech village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Victor and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Victor works as a business owner, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Victor and other promoters in his community (including Mary, Herenita and Enock) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Victor will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Victor wants to be a promoter because he sees it as a project that will help the community. Victor believes that the dispenser will prevent water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Victor’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: María De Los Santos

texts.es: María, con 48 años de edad, se dedicó desde el año 1999 a vender comida de manera ambulante, idea que surgió de la precaria situación económica por la que atravesaba su familia, con la idea de generar más ingresos para llevar el alimento diario a sus 5 hijos y solventar los gastos básicos del hogar. Desde hace aproximadamente 8 años toda la responsabilidad económica del hogar, recayó sobre ella, ya que sufrió la pérdida de su esposo; sin embargo, luego de afrontar su dolor tuvo que tomar nuevamente la fuerza para seguir adelante, motivada por el amor a su familia, se dedicó a sacar adelante su negocio y con la ayuda de las autoridades de espacio público logró organizar mejor el puesto de trabajo; logrando atraer más clientes. Actualmente solicita nuestro apoyo, ya que con el dinero del crédito requiere comprar un enfriador e insumos al por mayor (carnes, harina, aceite, verduras, gaseosas, café, entre otros), así tendrá la posibilidad de ofrecer un mejor servicio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes; lo que le permitirá generar mejores ingresos para seguir apoyando a sus hijos y para invertir más en su unidad de negocio, así lo irá fortaleciendo y en un futuro espera que crezca lo suficiente para poder generar oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
María, 48 years old, has been working selling food (from a food cart) since 1999. At the time her family was experiencing economic difficulty, so she started her business to help earn money to feed her 5 children and support her family's daily needs. Approximately 8 years ago, María became solely responsible for her family's well-being, as she suffered the loss of her husband. Nevertheless, despite the pain that she went through, she found the strength to move on. Motivated by her love for her family, she worked hard to grow her business and with the help of local authorities she managed to secure a fixed location from which to sell her food. This has helped her to attract more clients. 

Currently, she is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator and wholesale ingredients such as meat, flour, cooking oil, vegetables, sodas, and coffee among other items. With these goods she will be able to offer her clients better service and satisfy their demands. She will earn more money with which she will continue to support her children, as well as invest more in strengthening her business. In the future, she hopes that it grows to be large enough that it generates employment opportunities for others.

loans.use: to buy a refigerator and wholesale ingredients (meat, flour, cooking oil, vegetables, soda, coffee, etc.)

loans.name: Hezron's Group

texts.en:
59 year old Hezron has 8 children, and lives in Saosi A village in Vihiga, Kenya. Saosi A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Hezron and his  family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Hezron works as a subsistence farmer growing maize, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Hezron and other promoters in his community (including: Josina, Nichodemas and Rose) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Hezron  will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. He wants to be a promoter because he is trusted by community members and this waterpoint is in on his piece of land so he wants to take care of it. Hezron believes that the dispenser will prevent waterborne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Hezron’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Sheila

texts.es: Sheila, de 36 años, es una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Sheila es la venta de golosinas variadas como chicles, caramelos, galletas, chocolates, chupetines, jugos, postres y otros. Tiene un local que alquila mensualmente en una zona muy transitada de la ciudad. Afortunadamente siempre tiene buenas ventas durante todo su horario de trabajo. Renueva sus productos de manera semanal llegando a invertir altas sumas de dinero. Lleva en esta actividad más de 7 años y en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su cónyuge. De manera paralela se dedica a la distribución de bebidas. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que puede tener un ingreso económico que ella misma genera que le permite solventar sus necesidades y colaborar con algunos gastos del hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará más golosinas como caramelos, hojuelas de maíz, chicles, galletas, bocaditos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Sheila is 36 years old, a fighter, and a very hardworking woman. She is married and has 3 kids who live in her household. The work that Sheila does is the sale of different snacks such as gum, candy, cookies, chocolates, lollipops, juices, desserts and more. She has a building she rents monthly in a very busy area of the city. 

Fortunately, she always has good sales during her work schedule. She replenishes her products on a weekly basis which allows her to invest in larger sums of money.  She's been doing this for 7 years and on occasion she gets help from her spouse.

At the same time, she works in the distribution of beverages. What she likes about this job is that she can have an economic income she makes herself and it allows her to care for her needs and to devote some of her spending towards her home.  

This time she will ask for 3,000 soles. She is very grateful for the opportunity and the confidence you all have in her to get the loan. Furthermore, she agrees to comply with her payments on time. With the requested loan, she will purchase more sweets such as candy, corn flakes, gum, cookies, snacks, along with some other things.

loans.use: to buy candy such as gum, cookies, snacks, among other things.

loans.name: Dolores Isabel

texts.es:
Dolores, se decide a tomar otro crédito por que con el anterior pudo comprar la cantidad de maíz necesaria para aumentar su producción de tortillas para venderlas a sus clientes, mejoro sus ingresos, da una mejor atención, atrajo más clientes, hoy ofrece variedad de antojitos y ha cancelado sus deudas.
En esta oportunidad invertirá en compra de carnes, verduras, aceite, harina, etc., ya que son los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar antojitos que le permitirán seguir trabajando y generando los ingresos necesarios para darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Dolores has decided to ask for another loan, as with her previous loan she bought the necessary quantity of corn to incrase her production of tortillas. This enabled her to increase her sales and income, and better attend and attract more clients. Today she offers a variety of snacks and has paid off all of her debts. 

Currently, she would like to invest in the purchase of meat, vegetables, cooking oil, flour, and other ingredients necessary to make her snacks. This will enable her to continue her work, generating the income she needs to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Friendly, goal-oriented, reliable and well-liked Phanice from Gamuguywa village in Vihiga, Kenya, has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. She has 5 children and lives with her family in a house made of concrete walls, concrete floor and an iron roof.

Gamuguywa village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Phanice and the 10 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Phanice has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Phanice volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to represent  her community on the kiva website and she also wants to help the community access safe water. There are also three other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Solomon, Joseline and Miriam.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Phanice’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Philis' Group

texts.en:
Philis lives in Bushigunga B village in Vihiga, Kenya with her family which includes 7 children (6 sons and a daughter). The community of Bushigunga B village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Bushigunga B’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Bushigunga B, 25 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Philis has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There is one other volunteer promoter from the surrounding community who is part of this group loan: Merceline.

Bushigunga B village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Philis believes that the dispenser will enable them to drink safe water and prevent diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Philis’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, es un señor de 51 años, es casado, tiene cinco hijos, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, él es el encargado de generar los ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, se dedica a sembrar granos básicos y crianza de ganado, es un oficio que aprendió de su padre, por su experiencia no se le dificulta realizar esta actividad.
Con la inversión comprara abono, semilla, fertilizantes y pagara el alquiler de la tierra en la que sembrara, tendrá los insumos necesarios para tener una buena cosecha, mayores ventas, más clientes satisfechos, ingresos mayores con los que ira cancelando las cuotas.
Su sueño es fortalecer más el negocio para que su economía mejore y brindarles una mejor alimentación, salud, vestuario y educación a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, 51 years old, is married and lives with his wive and their five children. He is in charge of earning money to cover his family's expenses, and he works cultivating basic grains and raising livestock. He learned this work from his father, and he does not find it difficult. 

With this investment he will buy fertilizer and seeds, and will pay the rent for the land where he plants his crops. He will have the necessary ingredients for a good harvest, greater sales, and more satisfied clients. With the income that he earns from his crops, he will pay back the loan that he is borrowing. 

Luis' dream is to strengthen his business so he can improve his financial situation, and provide his family with better food, health, clothing and education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay to rent the land

loans.name: Eliza

texts.ru: Элиза 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старший сын - студент, остальные двое - школьники.Супруг работает наемным рабочим у частных лиц. У Элизы - средне-специальное образование, долгое время она проработала в школе преподавателем. На данный момент - домохозяйка занимается воспитанием детей и разведением скота. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Элиза занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Элизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 телка, 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элиза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Элиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Eliza is 40 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Her eldest son is a student, and the two others are in school. Her husband works doing wage labour for private persons. Eliza has vocational training, and for a long time she worked at a school teacher. Currently she is a housewife raising the children and breeding livestock. 

As a main income for her family, Eliza works with livestock breeding, after having started 17 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Eliza's persistent work, her farm currently has a dairy cow, a calf and six sheep. The monthly income is 7,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to develop her business, Eliza turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase cows to increase the number of livestock. Eliza plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for the further education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Ban Xom Group

texts.en:
Mrs. On is a Thai woman of 51 years. She is now living in a three-generation home with her husband, her son and his wife, her daughter, and her 1-year-old granddaughter. 

Farming is the main business activity which generates income for her family. To have enough money to cover living expenses, she has diversified her production. Thus, besides cultivating rice, she plants vegetables, and breeds pigs, cattle and fish. Despite On's effort to earn money, her son had to drop out of school at grade 10 and her daughter is illiterate. This is her first loan with the Anh Chi Em Program, and she wants to use her portion of the money to buy more fish to compensate for recent damage from a lean harvest. 

She hopes that her grandchild will have a more abundant life and will go to college and have a good job with a high salary; then their life will be improved.

Mrs. On is the team leader of Ban Xom Group, which consists of 10 Thai women. In the picture, she's holding a herbaceous branch.

loans.use: to buy more fish to compensate for recent damage from a lean harvest

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna, de 37 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, está casada con Elvis y junto a él tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 1 año de edad, ambos trabajan mucho para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijo. El trabajo de Giovanna, consiste en la venta de comida por eso su labor se inicia muy temprano con la compra de los ingredientes que usa en la preparación de los platos. Tiene un pequeño restaurante en donde atiende a su clientela por las noches. Su establecimiento esta ubicado en una zona muy concurrida por lo que siempre sus ventas son favorables. Complementa sus platos con la venta de refrescantes bebidas envasadas o refrescos elaborados con frutas regionales. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad hace 5 años, en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo o de su hermana. Cuando se inició en este negocio tenía escasa clientela ya que su rubro laboral estaba orientado principalmente a la venta de bebidas, pero poco a poco fue centrando su objetivo en la venta de comida. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes para elaborar sus platos como arroz, condimentos, pollos, bebidas y otros.
texts.en: Giovanna is 37 years old. She is a kind and hardworking woman who is married to Elvis and they have three children together, aged 17, 15 and 1. They both work a lot to give their children a better quality of life. Giovanna's work is selling food. That is why she starts very early by buying ingredients that she uses to prepare the dishes. She has a little restaurant where she serves her customers in the evenings. Her establishment is located in a very busy area so her sales are always favorable. She complements her dishes with the sale of beverages in containers or juices made from regional fruit. She has been working in this activity for 5 years and on occasion receives help from her husband or her sister. When she started this business she had few customers and she was mainly oriented towards selling beverages. Little by little she set her objective on selling food. At this time, she is asking for S/. 2500. She is grateful for the opportunity being offered to cement her work plans. With the amount she has asked for she will buy ingredients to make her dishes such as  rice, condiments, chicken, beverages and more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such rice, condiments, chicken, meats, beverages and more.

loans.name: Begimkul

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который живет в сельской местности вместе со своей семьей, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Его зовут Бегимкул. Ему 48 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет   3 детей. Так как он живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Он более 15  лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Он хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условию проживания. Бегимкул запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This good man, who lives in a village together with his family, needs financial help. His name is Begimkul. He is 48 years old. He is married and raising three children. As he lives in a village, he has a good opportunity to expand his business, cattle breeding. 

For more than 15 years Begimkul has worked with cattle breeding, and he has great experience in this line of business. Thanks to the good condition of the cattle, he has returning clients. He would like to develop his business and get a higher income. With the income received, he plans to increase his living conditions. 

Begimkul requests a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to purchase livestock. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide and pay for farm labor

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, está en el proceso de recolección de la cosecha de frijol y necesita capital para pagar la mano de obra y compra de tres sacos de abono para cultivar maíz, con esto el tendrá un negocio muy fortalecido y podrá trabajar sin ningún problema.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo la ayuda para la compra de insumos agrícolas necesarios como abono, insecticida y fertilizantes, los cuales le permitieron tener una cosecha de maíz y frijol muy abundante, granos de calidad y mejores ingresos. Su familia se encuentra muy saludable y hoy  cuenta con mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José is in the process of collecting his bean harvest, and needs money to pay some farm laborers to help him with this task. He also needs to buy three sacks of fertilizer, which he will use for his corn crops. This will allow him to have a stronger business and work without problems. 

With his previous loan, José bought agricultural products such as fertilizer and insecticide, which allowed him to protect his corn and bean crops and have an abundant harvest. He was able to produce higher quality grains and improve his income. His family is healthy and today they have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for farm labor and to purchase three sacks of fertilizer

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Ana, opta por otro crédito para realizar una compra de arroz, aceite, frijoles, pollo, azúcar, bebidas, etc., de esta manera surtirá la tienda para ofrecer variedad y calidad de productos a sus clientes, ya que en estas fechas de fin de año las demandas aumentan.
Con el crédito anterior fortaleció el negocio, mantiene  a sus clientes satisfechos, aumento sus ventas, su economía es más estable y brinda a su familia mejor alimentación, sigue ayudando con otros gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Ana is asking for a new loan to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, chicken, sugar, drinks, etc., which she will use to stock her store and offer a greater variety and higher quality of products to her clients. The demand for her products increases significantly towards the end of the year. 

With her previous loan, Ana was able to strengthen her business, keep her clients happy, increase her sales, and improve her economic situation. She has been able to provide her family with better food and continue supporting her home expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, chicken, sugar and drinks, etc.

loans.name: Loice's Group

texts.en:
Loice is 50 years old and has 8 children, and she lives in Gamgoi village in Vihiga, Kenya. Gamgoi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Loice and her  family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Loice works as a subsistence farmer growing maize and potatoes, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Loice and other promoters in her community (including: Collins, Chausika and Lydia) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Loice will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Loice wants to be a promoter because she as a parent knows how it feels to have waterborne diseases so she would like to encourage her community to drink treated water. Loice believes that the dispenser will kill bugs in water, thus making it safe to drink.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Loice’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Agatha's Group

texts.en:
40-year-old Agatha lives in Jivuye village in Vihiga, Kenya with her husband and 6 children. Jivuye village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Agatha and her  family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Agatha works as a peasant farmer growing bananas and maize, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Agatha and another promoter in her community (Florence) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Agatha will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Agatha wants to be a promoter because she wants to help her community. She believes that the dispenser will make waterborne diseases a thing of the past.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Agatha’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Elijah's Group

texts.en:
Elijah lives in a home with mud walls, sand or dirt floor and an iron roof in Mpaka village in Vihiga, Kenya with his family which includes 2 children. The community of Mpaka village collects their drinking water from a borehole because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Mpaka’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Mpaka, 11 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Elijah has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There is one other volunteer promoter from the surrounding community (Betty) who is part of this group loan.

Mpaka village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Elijah believes that the dispenser will provide chlorine which kills germs in water. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Elijah’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Osuipa

texts.ru: Осуйпе 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Все дети - студенты. У Осуйпы - высшее образование, сама Осуйпа  и ее супруг работают в местной школе преподавателями физики и математики. У обоих супругов аналитический склад ума. Они воспитали не одно поколение учеников. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Осуйпа занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 9,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Осуйпы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 4 лошади и 25 овец. Для содержания скота имеются все условия.Осуйпа своевременно проводит ветеринарные прививки в профилактических целях. По хозяйству помогает вся семья. Заготавливают корма на своем земельном участке. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Осуйпа обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Осуйпа планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство хозяйственных построек на территории дома.
texts.en:
Osuipa is 47 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. All the children are students. Osuipa has higher education, both she and her husband work at the local school as teachers of physics and mathematics. They both have analytic minds. They have raised more than one generation of school children. 

As a main income for the family, Osuipa works with livestock breeding, after having started 17 years ago with the purchase of 9,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent work, her farm currently has four dairy cows, four horses and 25 sheep. They have the necessary conditions for breeding livestock. Osuipa at the same time conducts veterinary vaccination as a preventive measure. The whole family helps with the business. They harvest fodder at their own plot of land. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Osuipa turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase sheep, to increase the number of livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for building farm buildings on their land.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge es un padre dedicado a sus 3 hijos y su esposa, se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre trabajador y pujante. Su vida productiva comenzó en el campo, pues nació en el seno de una familia campesina quien le enseñó todas las actividades sobre el cuidado de los animales y cultivos, gracias a ello se desempeñó durante varios años como productor agrícola y a la vez alternaba su labor con la venta de mecato, licor, gaseosas entre otros productos con lo que complementaba los ingresos que recibía. Pero, desde hace aproximadamente 20 años, llegó a la ciudad, siendo una víctima más del conflicto armado y de las extorsiones de las bandas criminales del sector donde se encontraba, a quienes les tenía que pagar una cuota mensual para que le permitieran trabajar. Ya radicado con su familia, decidió montar una tienda de abarrotes en la que recibe el apoyo de su esposa, quien le colabora mientras el cumple su horario como empleado de construcción; así han logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y han podido progresar a pesar de todas las dificultades que la vida le presenta. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido en general al por mayor (mecato, dulcería, arroz, azúcar, café, galletería, lácteos, cárnicos, entre otros productos de la canasta familiar), así tendrá más variedad de inventario disponible para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de fin de año, generándole así un mayor nivel de utilidades, con las que podrá seguir velando por el bienestar de su familia y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, haciéndolo crecer cada vez más, pues su principal meta es convertirlo en un supermercado en el que pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y, que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor educación a sus hijos y disfrutar mejor calidad de vida al lado de los que ama.
texts.en:
Jorge is a father dedicated to his three children and his wife. He is a very hardworking and energetic man. He began his working life in the field, as he he was born into a family in the countryside that taught him all about caring for animals and growing crops. As a result, for many years he worked in agriculture, alternating his work with the sale of snack foods, liquor, sodas, and other products, which he sold to supplement his income. After about 20 years, he came to the city due to the armed conflict and extorsion from criminal gangs that he faced where he previously lived and worked. He was forced to pay the gangs a monthly fee just to be left alone to do his job. Instead, he decided to move and start a general store. He receives help from his wife who manages the store while he works construction jobs on the side. Working together, they have managed to support their family and help their children despite all the difficulties life has presented. 

Currently, Jorge is asking for a loan to buy goods for his general store (snack foods, sweets, rice, sugar, coffee, cookies, milk, meat, and other basic goods). This will allow him to diversify his inventory and satisfy his clients' demands, which always increases towards the end of the year. He will earn more income with which he will support his family's well-being and continue to invest in his business. As it grows, his main goal is for it to be converted into a small supermarket that will generate employment opportunities for others and guarantee his family economic stability. He would like to provide the best education for his children, and enjoy the best quality of life possible alongside those he loves.

loans.use: to buy various items for his store such as snacks, sweets, rice, sugar, coffee, cookies, milk, meat, and other basic goods

loans.name: Co Man Group

texts.en:
Bien is a Thai woman of 23 years. She is married with one 2-year-old child. Her brother-in-law also lives with them because his parents got divorced. 

To cover her family’s everyday needs, Bien works very hard by diversifying her agriculture activities, such as cultivating rice, vegetables, and cereal, and raising pigs, chickens and fish. At this time, she faces the difficulty of a recent poor harvest so she wants to invest more in breeding. Accordingly, in this loan cycle, she will use her portion of the money from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy piglets. 
 
Bien hopes that her family will always have abundant food and her child will go to university, become an official and have a better life. In the picture, she's standing on the far right and is holding a herbaceous branch.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 64 años, está casada con Jorge y fruto de su matrimonio tiene 6 hijos que ya son mayores e independientes, vive en su casa propia junto a 5 hijos de los cuales brinda mayor atención a su última hija de 16 años, ya que los demás generan sus propios ingresos. El trabajo de Marlene, consiste en la venta de comida, instala sus mesas y sillas en la vereda de su casa en donde ofrece a la venta gran variedad de platos regionales. Lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 2 años y trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos quienes le brindan el apoyo necesario para que todo siempre le vaya bien. De manera ocasional prepara postres los cuales pone a la venta en un parque cercano a su vivienda. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues continuamente está en contacto con las personas, se divierte, se relaja y sobre todo genera ingresos económicos para su hogar, de esta forma puede darle lo necesario a su menor hija. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes e insumos como arroz, carnes, condimentos,verduras, entre otros.
texts.en:
Marlene, 64 years old, is married to Jorge with whom she has 6 grown children. She lives with 5 of these children but provides the most attention to her youngest daughter who is 16 years old. The others all earn their own income. Marlene works selling food. She sets up tables and chairs on the sidewalk outside of her house, from which she sells a variety of regional dishes. She has been selling food for the past two years, and her children help her when necessary so that the business runs smoothly. Occasionally, Marlene will prepare desserts which she sells in a park close to her home. She really enjoys her work as she is always in contact with many people. She has fun, she relaxes, and most of all she earns the money she needs for her home which allows her to support her youngest child. 

Currently, Marlene is asking for a loan for 3,000 Soles. She is very grateful and happy to know that she can rely on the financial support that she needs to continue growing her business. With this loan, she will buy ingredients to continue her food preparation, including rice, meat, condiments, and vegetables, among others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, condiments, and vegetables, among others.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, который живет среди высоких Таджикских гор, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у него проблемы с финансами. Его зовут  Шухрат.  Ему 38  лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Климат его местожительства весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 15 лет он занимается скотоводством. У него большой огород, где выращивает сено для скота. Он продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Еще он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This man with a big heart of kindness and a beautiful soul, who lives among the high Tajik mountains, needs your help. Lately he has had financial problems. His name is Shuhrat. He is 38 years old, married and raising three children. The climate in his place of residence is rather favorable to growing field crops, and also to breed cattle. 

Shuhrat has been breeding cattle for more than 15 years. He has a large yard, where he grows hay for the cattle. He sells milk to his neighbors, and they are very happy to receive natural milk products. He also sells cattle, which he has bred for a few months. He has many customers at the market. 

Shuhrat would like to develop his business, but does not have the necessary means to do so. He requests a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to purchase cattle in order to develop his business. He has decided to use the income received to provide his children with a good education and modern technology. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es:
Medardo, es un señor casado, tiene cuatro hijos, para generar los ingresos necesarios con los cuales cubre los gastos de su hogar se dedica desde hace 20 años a administrar su negocio que fundo por iniciativa propia; el cual consiste en cultivar maíz, comprar cerdos y gallinas. Trabaja todos los días de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., a la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en administrarlo.
Comprará cerdos y gallinas, que engordara para luego venderlos a sus clientes, espera tener mayores ventas, un negocio fortalecido, mejores ingresos con los que cancelara sus crédito y atraer más clientes.
Anhela hacer crecer su negocio para seguir aportando en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Medardo is married and has four children. In order to generate the income necessary to cover his family's expenses, he has wored for the past 20 years cultivating corn and raising pigs and hens. He works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m., and to date has never had a problem with his business. 

With this loan, he will buy pigs and hens which he will fatten up to later sell to his clients. He hopes this will allow him to increase his income and strengthen his business. He will use his earnings to attract more clients and pay off his debt.

His dream is to continue growing the business to continue supporting his home expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs and hens

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jennifer requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries, like noodles, shampoo, sardines, and other groceries. She has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Jennifer would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like noodles, shampoo, sardines, and other groceries.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
Guadalupe, es casada, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 17 años, los cuales están estudiando, no poseen ayuda del extranjero, se dedica a vender granos básicos y también posee una sala de belleza, su horario de atención es de 8:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., es un negocio que emprendió por cuenta propia, la respaldan 9 años de experiencia, por lo que no ha tenido ningún problema en administrar su negocio.
Invertirá en la compra de maíz, frijoles, maicillo, con lo que su tienda estará surtida y dará una mejor atención a sus clientes, espera tener un inventario surtido, aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su economía con lo que cancelara sus deudas y aportara en los gastos de su hogar.
Anhela hacer crecer su negocio para ofrecerles a sus hijos una educación superior de calidad.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is married and has two children, 14 and 17 years old, who are studying. They do not receive support from abroad; she makes her living selling staple foods, and she also has a beauty salon. Her hours of operation are from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. It is a business that she started on her own. She has 9 years of experience, so she has not had any problems managing her business.

She will invest the loan in purchasing corn, beans and sorghum, which will stock her store and provide better service to her customers. She hopes to have a varied inventory, to increase her sales, and to improve her financial situation, which would allow her to pay off her debts and to cover household expenses.

She dreams of growing her business, in order to provide her children with a superior quality education.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of corn, beans and sorghum.

loans.name: Mary Jene

texts.en:
Mary Jene is 57 years old, married, and has six children.

Mary Jene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jene has been raising pigs for 20 years now and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Jene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
Wilber tiene 28 años y nació en Barrancabermeja, Santander, región ubicada en el centro de Colombia. Gracias al trabajo constante de su padre como comerciante y al apoyo de su madre, Wilber estudió Ingeniería Física en la Universidad Nacional de Colombia sede Manizales obteniendo el grado con distinciones. 

Wilber tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría  en Ingeniería Aeroespacial en Europa y para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, puesto que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos de exámenes de conocimiento e idioma y  la aplicación a las universidades. Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, 
Wilber anhela trabajar en proyectos de desarrollo aeroespacial impulsando este sector en el país.

Aquí está su historia: 

A pesar de que cuento con el apoyo de mi familia para cumplir este sueño, mis padres no pueden llegar a cubrir gastos tan elevados como estos debido a su limitada situación económica. Actualmente, estoy vinculado como profesor de álgebra, física y cálculo en un colegio en la ciudad de La Dorada. Al mismo tiempo, estoy trabajando con la Asociación Astronáutica Colombiana desarrollando proyectos de cohetes hidráulicos con estudiantes de colegio. Este dinero lo destino para mi manutención. Por esa razón, Kiva sería el apoyo que necesito para superar los primeros pasos de este largo camino y el impulso para poder realizar esta maestría en el exterior. No me quiero dar por vencido para cumplir este objetivo y sé que gracias a mi excelencia académica y un gran esfuerzo puedo lograrlo.

El desarrollo de las tecnologías experimentales en el campo de las ciencias espaciales se convirtió rápidamente en una de mis grandes pasiones. Siempre he amado  estas ciencias, por tanto, no he podido dejar de imaginarme viajando y caminando en nuevas tierras. Me resulta extremadamente maravilloso y emocionante, es un mundo en el que siempre hay algo nuevo por descubrir.

Estimular los conocimientos de las ciencias espaciales en niños son algunas de las razones por las que me gustaría hacer una maestría en Ingeniería Aeroespacial en el exterior. El reto de vivir en otro idioma y en otra cultura es algo que sé que me encantaría hacer, así como ampliar mis conocimientos. Mi deseo en el futuro es crear una empresa de base tecnológica y contribuir al desarrollo de mi país. Además, es una gran oportunidad y será el motor para continuar perfilando mi carrera en el campo académico y ampliando mis perspectivas en el campo profesional. La única garantía que tengo es dar lo mejor de mí para cumplir mi sueño.
texts.en:
Wilber is 28 years old and was born in Barrancabermeja, Santander, located in central Colombia. Thanks to his father's dedication to his work as a salesman, as well as the support of his mother, Wilber studied Physical Engineering at the National University of Columbia. He graduated with honors. Wilber's dream is to get his Master's Degree in Aerospace Engineering in Europe, but to do so he needs the support of Kiva to help cover the expenses for entrance exams and application fees. Wilber hopes to return to Colombia with his degree, to work on aerospace projects in his country. 

Here is his story:

"Although my family supports my dream, my parents are unable to cover the high costs it entails due to our limited financial situation. Currently, I am working as a teacher of algebra, physics and calculus in a local high school. At the same time, I am working with the "Colombian Astronautics Association" developing hydraulic rockets with my high school students. The money I am earning will be used to cover my living expenses while I study. For this reason, I need Kiva's help to get over the first hurdle in this long journey of studying abroad. I do not want to give up on this dream, and I know that I will be successful because of my prior academic success and the effort I will put into my future studies. 

The development of experimental space technologies quickly became one of my biggest passions. I have always been interested in science, and find it very exciting to be part of a world where there is always something new to discover. Stimulating science knowledge in others, especially in children, is one of the reasons why I would like to get my Master's Degree in Aerospace Engineering abroad. The challenge of living with another language, in another culture, is one that I would love to take on in order to broaden my horizons. In the future, I wish to create a technology company that will contribute to the development of my country. This is a great opportunity for me to continue my career and increase my professional opportunities. I will give everything I have to complete my dream.

loans.use: to finance the aplication costs for a Master's Degree in Aerospace Engineering

loans.name: Mable's Group

texts.en:
Mable lives in a home with mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof in Jivudavaji village in Vihiga, Kenya with her husband and 8 sons. The community of Jivudavaji village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Jivudavaji’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Jivudavaji, 20 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Mable has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are two other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Pamela and Stephen. 

Jivudavaji village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Mable believes that the dispenser will help prevent waterborne diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Mable’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Braulia Nohemy

texts.es: Braulia, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres en el municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. Hace dos años que estableció su negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, manteca, café, pan, verduras, refrescos, churros, condimentos, jabón, papel higiénico etc. Ella obtiene otros ingresos ya que imparte clases a los adultos en la comunidad a medio tiempo. Solicita 12,000 Lempiras para surtir la pulpería con productos como embutidos, harina, cornflakes, y otros, con el propósito de aumentar las ventas y para obtener mas ingresos y terminar los estudios universitarios y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Braulia is 25 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the town of San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. Two years ago she established her small grocery business where she sells food products like rice, sugar, butter, coffee, bread, vegetables, soft drinks, churros, condiments, soap, toilet paper, etc.  She earns other income by teaching classes to adults in her community in her free time.  

Braulia seeks 12,000 Lempiras ($600) to stock her small grocery with products like sausages, flour, cornflakes, and others, in order to increase sales and earn more revenue to finish her university studies and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase products like sausages, flour, cornflakes, and others to resell.

loans.name: Robert's Group

texts.en:
Robert is 33 years old and works as a primary school teacher in Chemojech A village in Vihiga, Kenya. Chemojech A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Robert and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Robert works as a schoolteacher, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Robert and other promoters in his community (including Alice, Konzolata, Josephine and Kevin) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Robert  will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Robert wants to be a promoter because he is reliable and honest, and he believes that the dispenser will promote good health. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Robert’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Shadrack's Group

texts.en:
In Jitambuni A village in Vihiga, Kenya, Shadrack has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Shadrack is a friendly, goal-oriented, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, well-known and well-liked member of the community with 7 children. Shadrack lives with his family in a house made of concrete walls, concrete floor and an iron roof.

Jitambuni A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Shadrack and the 10 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Shadrack has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. He volunteered to be the promoter because he is willing to educate the community on safe water. and he wants to help the community by ensuring there is a continuous supply of chlorine that kills bugs in water thus preventing illnesses. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Beatrice, Emily, Faridah and Jane.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Shadrack’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Co Kho Group

texts.en:
Thiet (wearing orange coat with branch in hand) is the elected team leader of Co Kho Group, which consists of eight Thai women. 

Thiet is 26 years old and married with two children. One is in second grade and the other is just two years old. Thiet lives with her mother-in-law and supports a nephew who is studying in vocational school. 

Cultivating rice is Thiet family's main production, but it doesn't bring enough income for her family's needs, especially because of the bad harvest. 

Correspondingly, growing vegetables and cereals, breeding poultry and cattle are additional agriculture activities that her family is doing now.  Not only that, Thiet's husband works in the construction field.  To increase income, Thiet wants to apply for a loan from Anh Chi Em Program to expand her business.  Specifically, she would use a portion of loan to buy piglets. 

This is Thiet's first loan in the Anh Chi Em Program and she hopes that through this loan, her family's living standard could be improved.  She dreams that her children will get the best education, go to university and escape the vicious circle of poverty.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: José Silvano

texts.es:
José de 35 años de edad,  es un hombre muy trabajador, que a pesar de no haber estudiado, aprendió el oficio de la albañilería que hoy realiza. Actualmente, vive con su hijo de 8 años que estudia 2° grado y con su compañera de vida, quien se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalago. Ademas de vender,  su compañera de vida, cuida 2 vacas que tiene José, ya que una esta en producción y es necesario darles los cuidados pertinentes.

José  pasa trabajando de ayudante de albañil por 25 años y después decidió poner en practica todo lo aprendido de sus compañeros de trabajo. También, tiene 2 vacas atrás de la casa, de las cuales una esta en producción de leche.

Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando,  para que pueda comprar una vaca en producción de leche y así poder tener mas ingresos. Ademas, podrá hacer quesos para darle a su hijo una buena alimentación. 

José,quiere en un futuro dejarle a su único hijo, unas vacas para que pueda valerse por si mismo.
texts.en:
José, who is 35 years old, is a very hardworking man.  In spite of not having studied, he learned the masonry profession, in which he works today.  He lives with his 8-year-old son who is in second grade, and with his life partner, who sells beauty products from a catalog. In addition to selling, José’s life partner also takes care of his two cows, as one of them is producing, and it is necessary to provide them with appropriate care. 

José had been working as a mason’s helper for 25 years, and he decided to put into practice everything that he learned from his co-workers.   Also, he has two cows behind his house, one of which is producing milk. The loan will be helping him to purchase a dairy cow, and thus he will be able to have more income. Also, he will be able to make cheese so that he can provide good nutrition for his son.

In the future, José wants to give some cows to his only son, so that he will be able to provide for himself.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Telma

texts.en:
Telma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more LPG tanks needed in her business. This business has been running for two years now. Her loan is helpful not just in her business but also in the education of her children. She and her husband are both working to provide for their everyday expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy more tanks of LPG to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Telma dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have a vacation with her family. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more tanks of LPG to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Nery Elena

texts.es: Nery Elena mayor de edad casada con dos hijas menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, es propietaria y administradora de un camión con el que presta servicios de transporte de carga pesada a través de contratista a empresas privadas y estatales específicamente traslado de semilla de maní, actividades que se desarrollan en el occidente de nuestro país, Inicia su negocio con capital propio producto de sacrificios propios y de su familia, Nery desea realizar cierto cambios en su hogar en un futuro no muy lejano instalar cerámica a mi vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito es para activo fijo en la compra de llantas optimizando, mejorar su unidad de trabajo para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.-
texts.en: Nery Elena is a married woman with two dependent daughters. She was born in Chinandega in eastern Nicaragua. She owns and manages a truck, which she rents to companies and government agencies to transport heavy loads, specifically peanut seed, in eastern Nicaragua. She started the business with her and her family's hard-earned money. Nery wants to make improvements to her home and install tile soon. She will use this loan to buy quality tires for her truck so that she can offer her customers better service.

loans.use: to buy tires and equipment for her work vehicle.

loans.name: Khujamberdi

texts.ru:
Хучамберди житель села района Кубадиён. Ему 57 лет. Он женат и имеет детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Хучамберби работает учителем физкультуры в школе. Это его профессия, но не основная деятельность. Дополнительно он занимается земледелием и еще имеет свой маленький магазинчик по продаже продуктов питания. Хучамберди на своей земле выращивает пшеницу. Ему по работе помогает его семья. 
   5 лет назад Хучамберди открыл свой магазин по продаже продуктов питания. До сих пор его магазин осуществляет свою деятельность. В ассортимент его продукции входят сладости конфеты, напитки и другие продукты. Хучамберди просит кредит, чтобы расширить свой ассортимент продуктов. Он считает, что с расширением различности товара увеличится количество его покупателей.
texts.en:
Khujamberdi is a resident of a village in the Qubadiyon region. He is 57 years old. He is married and has children. His wife is a housewife. Khujamberdi works as a physical education teacher. This is his profession, but not his main activity. In addition he works with farming and also has his own small grocery store. 

Khujamberdi grows wheat at his land. His family helps him with the work. Five years ago, Khujamberdi opened his grocery store. He still operates his store. His product assortment includes sweets, candy, drinks and other products. Khujamberdi requests a loan in order to expand his product assortment. He thinks that expanding with different goods will increase the number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase food products and expand the assortment at his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and cooking oil

loans.name: Carlos Misael

texts.es:
Carlos, es casado y padre de un niño de 6 años, vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, el posee una tienda y venta de tortillas es apoyado por su esposa, también sale a vender cinchos y carteras, por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en su negocio.
Invertirá en la compra de cinchos, carteras, maíz y leña, tendrá fortalecido su negocio para estas épocas que las ventas aumentan, espera mejorar los ingresos, cancelar sus deudas y seguir atendiendo más clientes.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Carlos is married and has a 6-year-old son, who lives with him and his wife. Carlos and his wife run a tortilla shop and also sell rings and purses; they currently don't have any problems with the business. He will use the loan to buy rings, purses, corn, and wood to stock his business for this season when sales are strong.
