Rana is requesting a loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees as she doesn't currently have enough money.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is 21 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbed with his three siblings and his parents. His father is a retired man. Shadi is in his first year of studies at the university where he hopes to earn a bachelors degree in accounting. He is planning to continue his studies and then find a job in his field of study after graduation. Shadi hopes to start earning a better income to help his family financially. 

Shadi is requesting a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees as he doesn't currently have enough money.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mturio Nyakorogati Group

texts.en:
Mturio Nyakoragati is a Nuru International group of three farmers in Kuria West district in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group the members collectively guarantee the loan.

Daniel, who is a representative of the Mturio Nyakoragati Group of Nuru farmers, has been farming with Nuru for three years. He has been able to learn better farming methods and hence gain higher yields in terms of the harvest. With the loan from Kiva, he hopes to obtain farm inputs, which will enable him implement the better farming methods he has been able to learn. He hopes to harvest enough to sustain his family’s food security and sell the surplus to get money to pay for his three children who go to school.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Nehad

texts.en:
Nehad is 24 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her six siblings and her parents. Nehad is in her fourth year of studies at the university where she hopes to earn a bachelors degree in sport training. She is planning to continue her studies and then find a job in her field of study after graduation. Nehad hopes to start earning a better income to help her family financially.

Nehad is requesting a loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees as she doesn't currently have enough money.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: consuelo de 41 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere hacer una mejora en su vivienda pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales como cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para poder construir un muro atrás de su casa y poder instalar la luz en la cocina para que ella y sus hijos puedan vivir cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Consuelo is 41 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own home with her four children. Consuelo has had a small store in her home for various years. With the earnings she obtains from the store she can pay for some of the expenses of her home. She wants to improve her home, but with what she is earning she can't accomplish this goal. This is the reason she is seeking a loan to purchase materials like cement, sand, bricks, iron and payment for manual labor to construct a wall next to her home and to install lights in the kitchen so that she and her children can live comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to purchase materials like cement, sand, bricks and iron, and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Sorphon

texts.en: Sorphon is 29 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a chef for more than three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed in a fish farm. He earns about USD 5 daily. Due to lack of funds, Sorphon is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a plot of land. This money will help her obtain a better place for her family to live. In the future, she would like to run her own fish farm and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she will build her house in the next two years.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish and other ingredients for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru:
Икром житель Руми. Ему 33 года. Он счастливый отец пятерых детей. У него есть 4 сына и дочка. Икром с женой рано поженились и поэтому старшему сыну Икрома 15 лет. Младшего сына зовут Умедчон ему 2 года. Икром очень сильно любит свою семью и старается всегда ради их благо. Икром как глава семейства должен своей жене и детям предоставить еду, образование и здравоохранение. Он старается всеми силами. 
  Икром работает в паспортном столе района Дж.Руми. Но дополнительно хочет начать новый бизнес по животноводству. Для обоснования бизнеса ему не хватает $3000, для такого бизнеса такая сумма является не большой. Потому что многие животные стоят очень дорого, и не каждый сможет начать и развивать бизнес в этой сфере деятельности. Икром понимает, что ему будет нелегко, но он не боится трудностей и следует вперед.
texts.en:
Ikrom is a 33-year-old resident of the J.Rumy region of Tajikistan.  He's the happy father of 5 children (4 sons and a daughter); he and his wife married young, so their oldest son is already 15, while their youngest son, Umedchon, is 2.  Ikrom loves his family more than anything and tries his best to provide for them.  As the breadwinner in the family, he is obligated to provide his wife and children with food, education, and medical treatment.

Ikrom is currently working in a passport office in J.Rumy, but would like to start raising livestock to earn some extra money on the side.  He feels he needs to borrow $3000 in addition to what he's already saved in order to get started, which is really not a whole lot of money when you consider how much it costs to buy livestock.  Ikrom understands that it won't be easy to be a successful livestock farmer, but remains undaunted by potential hardships, and will move forward with his plans, come what may.

loans.use: buy bull calves and set up a new livestock-raising business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad tranquila que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de ganado vacuno y caprino desde hace cinco año, cuenta con clientela fija en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ovejas y una segunda parte para la compra de alimentos balanceados, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 38, lives with his wife in La Matanza district, a tranquil community that is characterized by its carob tree forests. Its population works in agriculture, trade and cattle raising. Two hours from the city of Piura, northern coast of Peru.

He has been making his living selling cattle and goats for the last five years. He has a fixed clientele in the area. He has applied for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles for the purchase of sheep and a second part for the purchase of balanced feed. This will let him have better production to offer to his clients and, in this manner, generate better income for his family.

loans.use: purchase balanced feed and buy sheep.

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak lives in the village of Sarigyugh that is in the Tavush region. He has a large family, and he lives with his wife, parents, and his son’s family. 

He has a rich farm and thanks to farming and agriculture, he provides his family with good living conditions. On his farm he has nine cows, one bull, eight heifers, three piglets and twenty-five chickens. As a skilled farmer, Arshak manages to sell his farm products (dairy-products, meat, milk and eggs) both at the local wholesale market and through re-sellers. 

Arshak greatly hopes to have a decent income through the help of this loan, since his first two loans from Kiva were very productive for him.

He is asking for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to buy a cow, several piglets, and a lot of animal fodder for the winter months.

loans.use: to buy a cow, several piglets and a lot of animal fodder for the winter months

loans.name: Felna

texts.en:
Felna is 35 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past eight years, Felna has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells such items as canned goods, shampoo, hair conditioner, detergent, soap, soft-drinks, and other products. 

Felna is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 48 years old and married with three children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like snack foods, chocolates, biscuits, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Fe has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 52 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lanie has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries to sell. 

In the future Lanie would like to save enough to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Reham

texts.en: Reham is 22 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa with her three siblings and her parents. Reham is studying in her 1st year for her Bachelor's of English Literature. She is planning to continue her studies to find a job in her study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help her family financially. But she doesn't currently have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is 25 years old. She is widowed and lives alone in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. Reham is in her second year of studying for her master’s degree in business administration. She hopes to find a better job in her field after graduation. 

Reham is requesting a loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees, as she currently doesn’t have enough money. In the future, she hopes to support herself financially.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Shamem's Group

texts.en:
Shamem is a vigorous 45-year-old lady who is the mother of three children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. Shamem stitches clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Shamem is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history.

Shamem is requesting a loan from the Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. Her loan will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time and to generate a healthier income.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 59-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two daughters and four sons. 

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son. Her son is a tailor and very expert in his profession. He has been sewing clothes for many years, which is the reason he has gotten a lot experience in his profession. His sewing machine is out of order and needs to be replaced with a new one but he does not have sufficient money to buy a new machine.

Therefore, Tasleem requested a loan for her son so that he can buy a new sewing machine. Her family members have to do hard work to earn an income for their huge family. Her younger son also provides some monthly income. Tasleem wants to arrange a dowry for the marriage of her daughter, which is why she is saving most of their earnings.
 
Tasleem is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her son's business.

loans.name: Al-Nada Group

texts.en:
Asila is a housewife with three children. Her husband works in a furniture store and earns a low salary that is not enough to cover her needs. Asila decided to assist her husband and improve their home. She is a member of a loan group called Al-Nada, which consists of four women who have requested a loan from AMB. 

Asila will use her portion of Al-Nada’s 200,000 YER loan to help her cover the costs of purchasing new furniture to use for her house. This will enhance home and give her family a good life. In the future, Asila hopes to enroll her children into private schools. The child who appears in this photo is the son of one of the group members.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture to use for her house

loans.name: Sreyoun's Group

texts.en:
Sreyoun is a 26-year-old mother of two children and a resident of a rural village in the Ponhea Krek district. The family's main source of income comes from rice farming and cassava planting. The current business earns her about 38,000 KHR per day to meet the needs of the family. 
This is the first loan for Sreyoun’s group of two members, both of whom are female. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Tul

texts.en:
Tul is 35 years old and is married with four children. She lives with her family in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. For the past five years, Tul has been raising and selling beef and she earns approximately 4 USD daily. Her husband is a driver who makes an income of 2 USD each day. Three of her children are employed in garment factories and earn 10 USD daily. 

Tul is requesting a 1,500 USD loan to purchase cattle to resell. She will use her loan to generate more income for the family. In the future, Tul would like to expand her business and help her children earn a higher education. Moreover, she plans to build a new house within the next two years.

loans.use: to purchsae cattle to resell

loans.name: Ajdar

texts.en:
Ajdar is a 33-year-old master stonemason. He has been in this business for seven years. Ajdar is married and has two children. His six-year-old son goes to first class, and his four-year-old daughter goes to kindergarden. His family lives in Pirallahi village of the Baku region.

Ajdar has applied for a loan in the amount of 2,100 AZN to buy new materials which are useful in his business.

He thankful to Komak and Kiva for their help. In the future, he wants to recruit an assistant and provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy new materials

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
Это Гавхар. Она юная швея в возрасте 22 лет. Гавхар живет с матерью, отцом, двумя братьями и младшей сестрой в городе Душанбе - столице Таджикистана. Гавхар начала свое швейное дело в начале 2010 года и уже более 3 лет как она занимается этим делом. Она шьёт женские национальные одежды и принимают заказы у себя дома. Ей в деле помогает мать. Гавхар еще не замужем. Она одновременно учится в заочном отделении Аграрного Университета и сама платит за учебу за счет своей швейной деятельности. 
Сейчас Гавхар хочет расширить свою деятельность. Она просит кредит для приобретения модернизированной компьютерной швейной машинки и тканей для шитья. С помощью этой швейной машинки она собирается теперь делать на платьях красивые вышивки. Естественно услуга за шитьё таких платьев будет стоить дороже и таким образом Гавхар хочет увеличить получаемый доход. В будущем она планирует открыть собственный швейный цех.
texts.en:
This is Gavhar, a young 22-year-old seamstress from Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan.  Gavhar lives there with her parents, two brothers and younger sister, and has yet to be married.  She first started working as a seamstress at the start of 2010, and, as such, has been at it for more than 3 years.  She works out of her home together with her mother, and specializes in Tajikistani folk apparel for women.  In addition to making women's clothes, she is also studying as a distance-learning student at a university specializing in agriculture, and is paying for her tuition out of pocket.  

Gavhar feels the time is right to start expanding her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy a modern computerized sewing machine, as well as some additional fabrics for sewing.  With the help of this new sewing machine, she'll be able to make more intricate patterns on her dresses.  Naturally, such dresses will command a higher price and allow her to earn more money, bringing her one step closer to realizing her future plans of opening her own sewing shop.

loans.use: buy a computerized sewing machine and various fabrics for sewing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, 55 years of age, is widowed and has three children. She owns and operates a retail business selling seasonings and ingredients for cooking daily meals. She's been in this business for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 500 per day. Usually her profits are spent on their electric bills, food expenses, and payments for her loan at the public market. But, due to the lack of capital, she would like a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase cooking oil, fish sauce, onions, garlic, and soy sauce to sell. She's hoping that through the loan that she requested, her business will continue to grow and earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, fish sauce, onions, garlic, and soy sauce to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza works hard to support her family. Esperanza is widowed and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Esperanza has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business, such as shell, nylon thread, etc.

Esperanza has been in this business for 30 years now. 

In the future, Esperanza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business, such as shell, nylon thread, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Arline

texts.en:
Ma. Arline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been running her business for the past three years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Ma. Arline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Ma. Arline is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
Clarisa tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica al cultivo de caña para comercializarlo a la empresa azucarera de la zona y agricultura, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, ubicado en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodeguita donde vende abarrotes leche, aceite, arroz, menestras, tiene clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con la compra de productos de primera necesidad y así generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Clarisa is 46 years old and lives with her family in Lagunas district, which is part of Chiclayo province, located in the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast. It is a community where people farm and grow sugarcane to sell at the area's sugar company

She has a small general store where she sells groceries such as milk, cooking oil, rice, pulses. She has a considerable clientele. She has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles for stocking her business through the purchase of basic household necessities, thereby generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: To buy basic household products.

loans.name: Fany Marisol

texts.es:
Fany Marisol tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en Sorronto Alto una zona rural de Oyotun, una comunidad que se caracteriza por cultivo de algodón, yuca, maíz y arroz, comercio y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo tienen una bodeguita donde ofrecen venta de productos de primera necesidad leche, menestras, aceite, arroz, pastas entre otros, Fany es una madre emprendedora has solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de productos navideños panetones, chocolate de taza, leche , dulces para bastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fany Marisol is 31 years old and lives with her husband and children in Sorronto Alto, a rural area of Oyotún located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. It is a community known for growing cotton, yuca, corn and rice, and for commerce.

She and her husband have a small grocery store where they sell basic household necessities such as milk, pulses, cooking oil, rice, pasta and other items. Fany is an enterprising mother and has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy Christmas products such as sweet bread, chocolate en taza (bars of chocolate used to make hot chocolate) and other items. This way she will generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: To buy Christmas products such as sweet bread, chocolate en taza (bars of chocolate used to make hot chocolate) and other items.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is 54 years old and she lives in Kadjaran city, which is in Syunik region. She graduated from the College of Pharmacy in Yerevan city. Now she works at the medical college and she teaches two subjects: medicine technology and commodity manager. Elmira is married and she lives with her husband and her son’s family. Elmira earns good money for her family, since she simultaneously has a business of her own. In a rented shop she sells food (bread, dairy products, cans, sweets, coffee, etc.) and household products. She manages to have a lot of customers during a day thanks to low prices and kind attitude towards customers. She brings her shop products from Yerevan wholesale market once every two weeks.

Elmira asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to refresh and enlarge her shop's product assortment.

loans.use: to refresh and enlarge her shop's product assortment (bread, dairy products, cans, sweets, coffee, etc.).

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Because Tamara is a conservative woman, she asked her daughter to take her place in this picture. 

Tamara was born in 1970. She lives with her husband and eight children at a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. She works as a teacher, and her husband is a salesman. 

One of her daughters is in her first year studying for her Bachelor's of Architecture and Design. She is planning to continue her studies to find a job in her field of study after graduation. This will enable her to start earning a better income and help her family financially. But, she doesn't currently have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

For this reason, Tamara applied for this loan to assist her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina, es soltera y tiene 25 años, nació en el municipio de Riberalta, en el departamento del Beni – Bolivia, vive con su hermana.  Desea culminar la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial en la Universidad Cumbre, motivo por el cual requiere un crédito educativo para financiar sus estudios.

Carolina trabaja desde hace 3 meses como Asistente de Informaciones del Banco Unión S.A., no tiene otros ingresos económicos ni tampoco otras actividades fuera del trabajo y de sus estudios. La principal motivación que tiene en la vida, es superarse personalmente y poder culminar sus estudios superiores. Ella cree que la carrera que estudia puede abrirle muchas puertas más adelante pues en cualquier empresa que se dedique al rubro comercial necesitan un profesional de esta área. Actualmente le va bien en sus estudios y solamente le falta un año para concluir los mismos. Igualmente le gusta su trabajo en el Banco y manifiesta que una vez se titule, le gustaría optar por desempeñarse en otras áreas de su actual trabajo, como por ejemplo el departamento de Marketing.  

Los ingresos de Carolina no son muy altos.  Sus padres viven en provincia y en estos momentos no la pueden apoyar económicamente pues son de escasos recursos. Buscando una mejor vida y nuevas oportunidades ella fue a vivir y estudiar a Santa Cruz junto con su hermana y todo lo que gana es para pagar sus gastos de manutención, por lo que necesita la ayuda económica que brinda el Programa para culminar sus estudios y titularse. Señala que tiene muchas ganas de alcanzar sus metas al más corto plazo pues uno de sus mayores deseos es ser una excelente profesional en su área y poder tener mejores ingresos económicos. 

Carolina se siente muy agradecida por que existan personas que deseen ayudar a otros, pues piensa que el ayudar, representa una noble causa ante la sociedad que es digna de admiración. Les pide a estas personas que sigan adelante con este propósito para llegar a más estudiantes necesitados como ella.
texts.en:
Carolina is single and 25 years old.  She was born in the municipality of Riberalta in the department of Beni, Bolivia.  She lives with her sister.  She wants to finish her commercial engineering degree at Universidad Cumbre, which is why she needs a student loan to pay for her classes.

Carolina has worked for three months as an information assistant at Banco Unión S.A. She has no other source of income and no other activities aside from work and school.  Her main motivation in life is to better herself personally and be able to complete her higher education.  She believes that the degree she is pursuing can open many doors for her in the future, as every business in the world of commerce needs professionals from her field.  Her classes are currently going well and she only has one year left to finish.  She also likes her work at the bank and, once she has her degree, she would like to branch out in other areas of her current job, such as the marketing department.  

Carolina's income is not very high.  Her parents live in the country and they cannot currently support her financially as they have few resources.  She and her sister went to live and study in Santa Cruz in search of a better life and new opportunities and everything she earns goes toward her upkeep, which is why she needs the financial help the program offers to finish her studies and get her degree.  She shows a great desire to achieve her goals in the shortest time possible, as one of her greatest dreams is to be an excellent professional in her field and be able to have better financial income.  

Carolina is very thankful that there are people who want to help others because she thinks that helping is a noble cause for society that is worthy of admiration.  She asks these people to keep doing what they are doing to reach other students in need such as herself.

loans.use: to finish her degree in commercial engineering

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: Fotima is a hardworking woman.  She is 33-years-old.  Fotima is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a migrant in Russia.  Fotima needs money.  She organized her own business deal of sewing national dresses three months ago.  Fotima rents a working place in a sewing workshop. She sews women's national dresses with modern fashion. She is a smart woman. Fotima began her sewing business with an old sewing machine of her mother's. Nowadays, she has a lot of clients and that’s why she needs a new sewing machine. Fotima is asking for a loan of 2,700 Somoni to buy a sewing machine to increase the working capital of her new business.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to increase the working capital of her new business.

loans.name: Eli

texts.es:
Eli tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el Caserío San Juan de Chorrillos una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques verdes y un relieve accidentado, a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que se ubica en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace diez años, su producción lo traslada hasta la provincia de Jaén para comercializarlo, ya que esta ciudad es el centro de acopio de todas las comunidades productoras de café.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su finca, con la compra de abonos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción y calidad para ofrecerlo, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Eli, age 30, lives with his parents in the San Juan de Chorrillos neighborhood.  It is a rural area in the Callayuc district.  Its population works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is a community that is known for its green forests and its rugged terrain.  It is two hours from the city of Cutervo, which is in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He has been growing coffee for ten years.  He transports his production to the Jaén province in order to sell it.  He does this because this city is the collection center for all of the coffee producing communities.

He has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to provide maintenance to his farm by purchasing fertilizers.  This way he will have a better production and quality to sell, and he will be generating greater income for his family.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to his farm by purchasing fertilizers.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock, who is 31-years-old, is married to Norah. He also supports five members of his family. 

He buys green tea leaves for resale in Kapsabet Town, and he has been in this business for one year. From this business, he earns a monthly income of 37,000 KES.

He has borrowed 60,000 KES, which he will use to purchase more green tea leaves for resale. 

He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children in addition to improving the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy green tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is thankful for the financial assistance expended to her. She used it in her piggery business in buying feeds and additional piglets. She also used it in her variety store in buying grocery items and in the maintenance of her jeepney. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her children. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda dreams that her business will never stop growing and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. Marlyn is married and has a buy and sell scrap materials business in the Philippines.

Marlyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and a married mother with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is 61 years old and she lives in Kapan City which is in Syunik region. This nice lady unfortunately has become a widow and now she feels great responsibility and attentiveness towards her two sons. Even though they are already grown up and can take care of themselves, Larisa as a devoted mother still tries to help and provide for them as much as it is possible. 

For six years, Larisa has been running her own clothes trading business (dresses, skirts, trousers, blouses and etc.). As she likes to say, all her successes in this field are by the help of Kiva lenders since she already has several successful deals with them. This time she asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy new winter collection clothes both for men and women.

loans.use: to buy new winter collection clothes both for men and women for reselling.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is a 31-year-old from a small village in the Sachkhere district. She lives there with her infant daughter and parents. Her family is involved in agricultural activities and they have a cow, whose milk is used in cheese products, along with a vineyard. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.  Dali has decided to a start clothing business with a loan. Unfortunately, the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers and Dali’s credit requests have been rejected several times, as she has been unable to satisfy their requirements. 

Dali is requesting a 2,000 GEL loan to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and resell it in her community door-to-door. Her loan is within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo – a Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  Dali plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women, and children. It is obvious that starting a business is hard for Dali, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. Her Start Up credit will be a great support for her family, as their income will be significantly increased.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Arkan Group

texts.en: Arkan is a group of four women from Sana`a, Yemen. They have requested a loan in the amount of 140,000 YER from AMB.  Sara, who is 18-years-old, is the leader of the group.  She is a resourceful and honest woman. She lives with her parents in a small house in Sana`a.  Her father is working very hard to cover the needs of his family, but his income is not enough to pay for everything.  She decided to help him to buy home appliances, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy home appliances for personal use.  She hopes that she will be able to improve her family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for personal use.

loans.name: Yainkain

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Yainkain from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 15 years old. Her children are going to school. After she got married, Yainkain established her cookery business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Yainkain requires a loan in order to buy more cooking commodities to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Yainkain plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to expand her business.

loans.name: Salome's Group

texts.en:
Salome is a member of Apokor SHG Group in Chwele District.  She is pictured here in a group of 7 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 60 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Salome has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Salome is 43 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years.  Salome works as a farmer to provide for her five children.  The community and other farmers know Salome as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community activities such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group and the burial committee.  Salome described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.					

The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Salome’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2009 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed her family and to send her children to school.  As an active member in her community, Salome also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Salome plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more profits from the harvest, more farm training, is able to save money and feed the family.							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with small-holder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Salome and the Apokor SHG Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Chapakazi A Group

texts.en:
Chapakazi A is a Nuru International group of five farmers in the Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group the members collectively guarantee the loan.

Joseph is 33-years-old and a member of the Chapakazi A group of farmers. He is married with five children, four of whom attend school. The loan he is requesting from Kiva wil enable him to purchase farm inputs. From the harvest, he will obtain food for his family, sell the surplus and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo desde que la mama quedo sola cuando al papa lo mataron a la mama le toco una vida muy difícil, pero esto no fue impedimento para que la mama le diera una buena educación, que fue la primaria y bachillerato, que es lo más indispensable, pero el desde que empezó a conocer lo relacionado con los computadores lo que más quería era estudiar algo relacionado con los computadores, pero cuando salió del colegio lo que mas quería le toco aplazar y le toco empezar a trabajar para de esta forma poder ayudarle a la mama con todo lo de la casa, pero la mejor forma era trabajar para ayudar con los gastos de la casa, esto por varios años, y a medida que pasaban los años la mama empezaba a requerir de  mas descanso por la edad, pero para el lo más importante era la mama por más que quisiera estudiar lo que más le gustaba tenía que seguir aplazándolo por que si quería estudiar de dónde sacaba para los gastos de la casa, por tal motivo seguía trabajando en lo que saliera a si le gustara todo lo relacionado con los computadores, y muchas personas le daban animo pero con el animo es muy difícil lograrlo hace falta plata que es lo que uno más quiere para lograrlo, desafortunada-mente ninguno de los dos tenia apoyo de nadie para lograrlo y lo que ellos ganaban no alcanzaba para todos las cosas que tenían que pagar, como son arriendo, comida y vestuario y mas que los dos eran solos era muy difícil y para sacar un préstamo piden muchas cosas y de dónde sacarlas para pagar el préstamo, sería otro problema que no estaba dentro de los alcances que unas personas como ricardo y la mama podrían hacerlo, por eso lo único que les quedaba a los dos era trabajar y esperar que mas delante de alguna forma se presentara la forma de que ricardo pudiera estudiar a si fuera en un largo tiempo, porque estudiando podría ganar más plata y trabajar en lo que le gustaba, por que cuando una persona está mejor preparada puede aspirar a tener un mejor nivel de vida, porque es lo que el siempre quiere para tener un futuro mejor, ricardo trabajo en muchas cosas incluso en una ocasión le salió un buen trabajo relacionado con los computadores, no lo pudo realizar por no tener ningún certificado que lo relacionara con una universidad o con algo que lo pudiera ayudar, porque en una ocasión trabajo con una empresa realizando mantenimiento para computadores, pero esto no era suficiente para que le dieran dicho trabajo esto lo desanimo pero no era para mas si el quería trabajar con los computadores y poder darle un mejor futuro a su mama y por falta de estudio no lo podía, lograr de esta forma, lo único que se podía era seguir trabajando y esperar la oportunidad que se sabía que en algún momento se presentaría, pero para esto paso un largo tiempo, pero ricardo mantenía esta esperanza muy viva porque siempre lo había tenido muy presente en sus metas por lograr, aun que la mama de ricardo también quería que su hijo pudiera estudiar para tener un mejor nivel en su educación era un poco difícil con lo poco que ganaban por que si ricardo estudiaba de donde pagaban el arriendo y la comida y las demás cosas que uno tiene que pagar en la vida, pero ricardo no perdía nunca las esperanzas de lograrlo, por que cuando una persona se pone metas en la vida siempre las logra a si sea en un tiempo determinado, pero el seguía trabajando muy juicioso para darle  a su mama mas alegrías que era tener un sitio donde vivir y lo que se requería para comer, hace una año ricardo empezó a  mirar donde podía estudiar pero los costos de todos eran  muy altos y el presupuesto era muy bajo pero el no se desanimo si no siguió buscando.
Busco uno que fuera cerca de donde vive para no tener que pagar transporte, cuando tenía formas entraba a Internet o buscaba caminando cuando tenía tiempo,  a si fue cuando un día llegando a la casa encontró un volante que tenía una información de una parte donde podía estudiar y al día siguiente se fue con su mama para averiguar los costos y los horarios para mirar si podía estudiar, le dieron toda la información que requería, lo que más le gusto fue que tenían un convenio donde las cuotas le podían salir más baratas y esto era mucho mejor para el presupuesto que tenia ricardo.
Necesito del convenio con kiva para que las cuotas le salgan más baratas y de esta forma poderse ahorrar más plata, porque a el le hace falta para otras cosas, por eso quiere tener la ayuda del convenio kiva. 

Muchas Gracias
texts.en:
Ricardo had a very hard life after his mother was left alone when Ricardo's father was killed.  This didn't stop his mother from giving him a good education, however.  He finished elementary school and high school, which are the most indispensable.

Once Ricardo began learning about computers, what he most wanted was to study something in that field.  When he got out of high school, however, he had to put this aside and start working to be able to help his mother at home.  The best way to do this was to help with the household expenses for several years.  And as the years went by, his mother began to need more rest because of her age.  For Ricardo, his mother was always the most important thing.

As much as he wanted to study what he most enjoyed, he had to keep on postponing it because he didn't have money for the household expenses if he was studying.  This is why he kept on working at whatever he could get, although he liked everything having to do with computers.  A lot of people encouraged him but it's difficult with encouragement.  What's needed is money; money is what one needs most to achieve this.

Unfortunately, neither of them had support from anyone to achieve this.  What they earned wasn't enough for everything they needed to pay for, such as rent, food, and clothing.  And more than this, the two of them were alone.  It was very difficult.  To get a loan, they ask for a lot of things and where they're going to get them to pay back the loan.  That was another problem--that it wasn't within the reach of people like Ricardo and his mother to do it.  The only thing they could do was work and hope that later something would come up so Ricardo could go to school.

That's the way it was for a long time, because by going to school he would be able to earn more money and work at what he enjoyed.  When someone is better educated he can aspire to have a better standard of living, because it's what he always wants so he can have a better future.

Ricardo worked a lot of jobs.  Once a good job working with computers came up, but he couldn't do it because he didn't have a certificate from a university or something that could help.

Once he worked with a business doing computer maintenance but it wasn't enough for them to give him a job, which was discouraging.  He wanted to work with computers and be able to give his mother a better future, and for lack of an education he couldn't do that.  The only thing he could do was keep on working and waiting for the opportunity he knew would arise.

A lot of time went by but Ricardo kept hoping, because he had always kept in mind his goals.  His mother also wanted him to go to school to improve his educational level.  It was difficult with what little money he earned, because if he was in school, they didn't have money for the rent, food, and the other things one needs in life.

Ricardo never lost hope because when people have goals in life they always achieve them within a determined amount of time.  He kept on working judiciously to make his mother happy and give her food and a place to live.

A year ago Ricardo began to look into where he could go to school, but the costs were very high everywhere and his budget was very low. But rather than losing hope, he kept on looking.  He looked for a school that was near where he lives so he wouldn't have to pay for transportation.  He looked on the Internet when he was able or, when he had time, he looked while he was walking.

One day one the way home Ricardo found a flyer with information about a place he could study, and the next day went with his mother to verify the costs and schedules to see if he would be able to study there.  They gave him all the information he needed.  What Ricardo liked most was that they had an agreement with lower payments, which was better for his budget.

Ricardo needs the agreement with Kiva so his payments will be lower and he'll be able to save more money.  He also needs money for other things, so he wants to have the help of  the Kiva loan.

Thank you very much.

loans.use: to pay his tuition for a semester

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
Penh is 43 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are working in a garment factory or construction. They make an income of $16 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Penh is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her children easily commute to work. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop for her children and build a new house next year.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fuel and seeds

loans.name: Japheth's Group

texts.en:
Japheth is a member of the Jitetee S.H.G Group in the Webuye District.  He is pictured here in a group of four One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of twenty-nine individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Japheth has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Japheth is married and has nine children.  He is 66-years-old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community, in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and the burial committee.  Japheth has been a farmer for thirty-six years.  Japheth described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

Japheth first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season.  Japheth joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send children to school.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader. He is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Japheth plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Japheth’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, is able to save money and feed the family.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with small-holder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and pass the cost savings onto the farmers.  Japheth and the Jitetee S.H.G Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Rosilene

texts.en:
Rosilene is 33 and married, and has always lived in Sorocaba-SP. She has two children, a 13-year-old and a 4-year-old. Her younger son was the reason that she started working at home, since she had no one to care for the child so that she could to go work, and she wanted to spend more time with her family.

She began selling clothing door-to-door, and today wants to open her own shop, in front of her house. With the money, she will finish the renovation and purchase goods to resell.

Rosilene is a caring and loving woman, and once a week takes her father to physical therapy (he had an accident 2 years ago and is still in treatment).

loans.use: To buy clothes, mannequin and showcase

loans.name: Mahsadoy

texts.en: Mahsadoy is a repeat client of IMON International. She is a kind and responsible woman. Mahsadoy has worked in a hospital for more than 31 years. She is a nurse. Thanks to her parents she got a medical education. Mahsadoy always wanted her children to get higher education. Now, her daughter is a student. Mahsadoy’s daughter studies well. She is 18 years old and a first year student. Mahsadoy must pay for her daughter’s education at the university but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 350 USD for this. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for education of her daughter.

loans.name: Ndoumbé

texts.fr:
Madame Ndoumbé, mariée et mère de famille, vit de son activité de commerce. Activité qu’elle a démarrée depuis l’âge très jeune. Elle a appris le métier avec sa tante qui vendait des légumes au marché. Avec un capital de soixante quinze milles, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de céréales locaux : mil, mais, arachides…Présentement, elle peut acheter moins cher, stocker pour revendre à un prix plus élevé lors de la période de rareté du produit. 
Ndoumbé a une grande part de responsabilité dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Elle appuie son époux et ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
Ndoumbé a déjà eu à bénéficier d’un apport financier de la part d’IMCEC et cela lui a permis d’acheter les céréales dont elle a besoin pour faire son commerce. Si elle possède une grande quantité, elle peut vendre aux revendeurs et devenir un fournisseur renommé.
texts.en:
Ndoumbé is a married mother, and makes a living from a business which she has had from a very young age. She learned her trade from her aunt, who sold vegetables in the market. She started her business with capital of 75,000 CFA francs, selling locally-produced cereals (millet, peanuts and corn). Now she can buy her stock at a cheaper price and resell it at a profit during periods when her produce is scarce. 

Ndoumbé assumes a lot of responsibility when it comes to managing her family’s daily expenses, as she supports her husband and her children with their education. She has already received financial support from UIMCEC, which allowed her to buy the cereals she needs for her business. If she can have a large quantity of produce, she can sell it on to resellers and become a well-known supplier.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale (millet, peanuts and corn)

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus dos hijos, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Sara no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Sara trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida típica de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Sara se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buena sazón.
Sara se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mesas y sillas para acondicionar su negocio, de esta manera desea brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, así pues Sara seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Sara is a 47 year old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her two children.  She is a hard-working single mother.  She puts all of her efforts into getting her family ahead.  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources and out of necessity, she had to start working when she was very young.  Sara was not able to study for a professional career.

On her own initiative, Sara works at her small business selling food that is typical of her city.  She works every day, starting at the early hours of the morning.  She is able to do so for approximately ten hours.  Sara likes working, and she believes that it is going well for her because of her dedication and good seasoning.

Sara is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help provided, she will buy tables and chairs to refurbish her business.  This way she wishes to provide better service to her customers.  This way Sara will continue working and putting forth great effort in order to fulfill her big dream of having a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro es un señor casado de 29 años quien tiene 4 hijos 3 mujeres y 1 hombre, quienes viven en Sololá. El se dedica a la agricultura y lleva 15 años en esta labor. Eligio está actividad porque le gusta y es donde obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos, con lo que gana cubre los gastos del sustento familiar. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de semilla y fertilizante orgánico para cultivo de papa. Sueña con construir su casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Pedro is a 29 year old married man. He has four children—three girls and a boy—and they live in Solola. He’s been working as a farmer for 15 years. He chose this work because he likes it and because it’s how he earns most of the income he needs to cover family expenses. He is asking for a loan of Q 5,000.00 to buy seeds and organic fertilizer to grow potatoes. He dreams of building a house to provider his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 51-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband sells fruits from a shop. He goes to the field daily to buy fresh fruits; he is very famous in the community due to the freshness of his fruit. He has been selling fruit for many years; because of this he understands the minds and demands of people. 
Therefore, Parveen requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more fruits, especially seasonal fruit like oranges.
Parveen is representing herself as a group leader and taking the responsibility of her group members. This is the fifth loan of Parveen; she assured us that she will pay all installments on time as before, because she wants to take another loan in the future. 
Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Parveen raises her hand in the given picture.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Iris tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Morropon,una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, bosques de algarrobo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, tmabien ofrece comida preparada, seco de chavelo, arroz con pato, cabrito, es una joven emprendedora que se esfuerza por hacer crecer su negocio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mesas, sillas y arreglo de su local de negocio y de esta manera tener un lugar más acogedor para sus clientes, aumentando su demanda e ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Iris, age 24, lives with her parents in the Morropon district.  This community is known for its warm climate and its forests of carob tress.  Its population devotes itself to agriculture, commerce, and works with livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells clothes for women, men, and children.  She also sells prepared food; ‘seco de chabelo’ [a traditional meat dish], rice with duck, and goat meat [kid].  She is an enterprising young woman, who puts forth great effort to make her business grow.

She has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to buy tables and chairs and to fix up her place of business.  This way she will have a more welcoming place for her customers.  She will be increasing her demand and the income for her family.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs and to fix up her place of business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is 20 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Madaba with his three siblings and his parents. His father is retired. Omar is in the third year of his bachelor's of sport rehabilitation. He is planning to continue his studies to find a job in his field after graduation so he can start earning a better income to help his family financially. He doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, and for this reason he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Godefroid

texts.en:
Godefroid is 55 years old. He is engaged and hoping to marry his desired wife in the near future. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilzer for maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
This is Melchora. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy additional merchandise like men's clothing, women's clothing and kids' clothing. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Melchora would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan so she can buy more stock of men's, women's and kids' clothing. The more items displayed at the store the better. Having more items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from the business will definitely help Melchora to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melchora dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her family will be safe all the time. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of men's, women's and kids' clothing

loans.name: Dima

texts.en: Dima is 21 years old. She lives in a rented house at a sector in Jordan called Wihdat with her 5 siblings and her parents. Her mother is a hair dresser. Dima is studying in her 4th year of her Bachelor of Business Administration. She is planning to continue her studies to find a job in her field after graduation to start earning a better income to help her family financially. But she doesn't currently have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 23 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Karak with his four siblings and his parents. One of his brothers is in the military. Ahmad is studying in his third year of his bachelor's of physics. He is planning to continue his studies to find a job in his field after graduation so he can start earning a better income to help his family financially. He needs to buy stationery tools and a computer for his studies, but he doesn't currently have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Hanamil

texts.en:
Hanamil is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hanamil is 31 years old and all of her children are in school.

Hanamil has a soft drink retail business in the Philippines. Hanamil requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

Hanamil has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Hanamil would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 35 years old. He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during maize production.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 47 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Veronica has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

Veronica has been in this business for six years. In the future, Veronica would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en: Bayan is 18 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa with her family. Bayan is studying in her 2nd year of her Bachelors’ of Marketing. She is planning to continue her studies to find a job in her study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help her family financially. But she doesn't currently have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 31-year-old woman, living with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Farzana’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays daily rent because this rickshaw does not belonging to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been supporting his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs grow as well. He decided to buy his own rickshaw so he wouldn't have to pay daily rent.

Farzana has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing some money became short. Therefore, Farzana requested a loan so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. She hopes that now her husband would be able to gain more income because now he will not pay daily rent to anyone. Farzana is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new auto rickshaw

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is 51 years old. She is married and lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a driver who makes an income of $5 daily. To improve her family’s finances, Mom is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cattle to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and resell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single young man from a small village called Attel near Tulkarm city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Mohammad works in a coffee shop and he earns a small income. This income helps him to pay his university installments, since he is still a student at the university. He studies Accounting and he would like to finish his studies, take the BA degree and then find a better job.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help to pay the university installment for this semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to complete his study and find a job as soon as possible 
 
Mohammad appears in the photo while he was in the university

loans.use: to pay for this semester's university fees

loans.name: Las Almendras. Group

texts.es:
La  Asociación comunal las Almendras está conformado por nueve integrantes madres soteras con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus familia, y prepararle platos típicos como indio viejo. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del la asociación comunal es  Concepción y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jabón, tiste, verduras, huevos, crema. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de producto comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal association "Las Almendras" (The Almonds) consists of 9 members who are single mothers, responsible for 15 children among them. They are originally from the northern zone of the region. They are characterized by being hard-working and responsible, with the will for personal achievement. In their spare time, they like to enjoy the company of their families, and they prepare typical dishes such as "indio viejo" (a Nicaraguan corn stew) for them. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, they were not able to go to school, since they were faced with the need to work from an early age.

Thanks to her effort and her will to advance, the coordinator of the association is Concepción. Her business is a little grocery store where she sells food and other items in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, soap, tiste (a cocoa flavored beverage), vegetables, eggs, and cream. She works in her business some 12 hours a day, offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business, so that in the not too distant future she can obtain better income.

loans.use: to stock her business, where she sells products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, soap, tiste (a cocoa flavored beverage), vegetables, eggs, and cream.

loans.name: Issac

texts.en:
Isaac is 38 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have spent 10 years in the farming business. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for his maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Because Wafaa is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Wafaa is married and has 7 sons and daughters. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh. One of her sons is studying in his 2nd year of his Diploma of Civil Engineering. He is planning to continue his studies to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Wafaa applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Shafeeqa

texts.en: Shafeeqa is 19 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa with her 4 siblings and her parents. Shafeeqa is studying in her 2nd year of her Bachelors’ of Economics. She is planning to continue her studies to find a job in her study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help her family financially. But she doesn't currently have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees
