texts.en:
Alphonsine is 46 years old. She is married with four children. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production: they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics products

loans.name: Ritty

texts.en: Ritty is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture, is a construction worker who earns about $5 daily. Due to lack of funds, Ritty is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase construction materials to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase farmland for rice cultivation and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix her house

loans.name: Nawal Al-Arooq Group

texts.en: This group is called Nawal Al-Arooq and consists of four women. Together, they are requesting a loan of 150,000 YER.  Newal is a 32-year-old married woman and comes from Sana'a, Yemen. She is a stay-at-home mother whose main hardship is the lack of money. She said that her husband's income is not enough to cover household expenses.  Newal's family is currently in need of a new fridge, so she is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB.  She is aiming to have a business store to gain more profits so she has the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and more foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anaclet

texts.en:
Anaclet is 38 years. He has been in the business for the past five years. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.name: Intisar

texts.en: Because Intisar is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Intisar was born in 1968. She is married and has 7 sons and daughters. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba and has her own kindergarden at home. One of her sons is studying in his 2nd year of his Bachelors’ of Civil Engineering. He is planning to continue his studies to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Intisar applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, is married, and has five children. Salem, along with 2 of his children, provides the family income together. Salem has been the owner of a block factory since 2009, and now he has a hired employee. He built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. 

He is requesting a loan of $1,800 to build an office in his workplace. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to build an office in his workplace

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long is 66 years old, married, has five children, and lives in a rural village of Baray, Kampong Thom with her husband and children. Long has been engaged in agriculture sector, farming rice and yams and raising some birds at home. She has been doing this for more than 20 years and has the support from her husband and children. She is able to earn an income of USD4.4 per day.

Long has been a honest client with HKL for eight loans already and this will be her ninth loan cycle, which she will buy a piece of land for enlarging her farming productivity. She believes that she will be able to improve her income in the coming season. Her goal is to get her family ahead and improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for enlarging her farming productivity.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Because Eman is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Eman is married and has 5 sons and daughters. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa. One of her sons is studying in his 1st year of his Bachelors’ of Accounting. He is planning to continue his studies to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Eman applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her sons' upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is married with five children. He is 39 years old. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.name: Vivian Camila

texts.es:
Ella es vivian camila, se acababa de graduar de bachillerato y esta estudiando auxiliar de enfermería para luego conseguir un trabajo estable y con ello pueda pagarse en la universidad la carrera profesional y cumplir el sueño de estudiar lo que a ella le gusta, con ello tener una estabilidad económica y ayudar a la familia con los gastos necesarios que tengan.
Actualmente esta por empezar segundo semestre en enfermería, pero tuvo un inconveniente con la matricula ya que le subieron a la mensualidad casi tres veces de lo que ella pagaba normalmente.
Pagar esa mensualidad era fácil ya que el padrastro le ayudaba mientras ella salia del colegio y ella tenia que pagar los materiales, uniforme que pedían, pero como ella ya se graduó ya no le ayudaron mas, le hablaron sobre un descuento que le podía ayudar que es el descuento con kiva, y le gustaria que este le ayudara para poder seguir con los estudios.
Piensa que cuando termine con la carrera le gustaría ayudar a toda la gente que necesita de ella, ya que eso e slo que mas le gusta y por eso eligió esa carrera.
texts.en:
She is Vivian Camila and has graduated with a bachelor’s degree.  Now she is studying nursing so she can obtain a stable job and be able to pay for her university expenses and achieve her dream of studying what she wants so she can have financial stability and help her family with their expenses.  She is getting ready to start her second semester as a nursing student but her tuition tripled. 

Paying her monthly tuition was easy because her step father helped her while she was a bachelor student and she had to buy her supplies and uniform, but now that she has graduated, they don’t help her anymore.  They talked to her about a discount that could help her, which is a discount through Kiva.  She would like to do this so she can continue her education.

She thinks that she would like to help everyone who needs it when she finishes school as this is what she likes to do and this is why she chose this field.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Serzhik

texts.en:
Serzhik was born in the city Goris which is in Syunik region. He is married and he is a father of four children; his two daughters are already married and they live with their families. His third daughter and his son still live with their parents. Serzhik works as a welder, but his small salary is not the only source of income of their family. Serzhik’s daughter works as a manager and his son is a builder. Lately Serzhik and his wife were surprised with the news of his son, who said that he wants to get married. It is a great and nice event for their family and they want to celebrate the wedding party properly and nice. 
Serzhik asks a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams in order to organize his son’s wedding party.

loans.use: to organize his son’s wedding party

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is 31 years old, married and has a single child. He is from Iraq. 
Mouhammad owns a small cafe where people come to relax, drink coffee and smoke the Middle Eastern hubble-bubble. He has been in this field for more than 4 years and established his own business in 2012. Mouhammad has 4 employees hired and has gained an excellent reputation in his surrounding area and is well-known in his neighborhood. Mouhammad is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD, which he will use to renovate his café and to install signage. Mouhammad is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so that he can provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his café and to install signage

Gabriel is 34 years old. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is an Iraqi youth client who is 24-years-old and single. Abbas lives with his family composed of 4 members, of whom 2 are employed.
Abbas owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2009 and now he has a hired employee. He has built up good experience in this field and is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. 
Abbas is requesting a sum of $1,800 as a youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator and a freezer for his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a freezer for his grocery store

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is age 26. He is married with one child. He has spent ten years in his business. He would like to use this Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming in his business so that he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Honorine est une dame âgée de 41 ans, mère de famille.  Elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la capitale quelle elle même depuis  10 ans environ. Son activité fonctionne bien grâce à son savoir faire, son accueil chaleureux et ses bonnes relations avec  le voisinage. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boisson parce qu'elle est souvent confrontée à des ruptures permanentes de stocks à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l(oblige à faire écouler une bonne partie de son stock avant de se réapprovisionner. Ceci augmentera non seulement son chiffre d'affaire mais aussi son bénéfice. Bénéfice qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en: Honorine is a 41-year-old mother. She has run a drinks stall in the city for around 10 years. She has the benefit of years of experience in this sector and good relations with neighbors. With this loan, she would like increase her stock of beverages and buy her license in order to satisfy her customers' demands. This will also increase her turnover, as well as her profits, which will allow her to set her business in order. The turnover generated will allow her to better meet her family's needs. Her ambition for her business is to be able to sell beverages in wholesale.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beverages

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is an Iraqi youth client who is 20 years old, single and lives with his family of 6 members, of whom 3 are employed and share the family income together.

Moustafa owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He has been in this field since 2011. He has built up good experience in this field and is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. Moustafa is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator, a freezer and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide himself a good future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, a freezer and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: José ramón es un joven que no deja de apoyar a su madre y hermanos ya que todos dependen económicamente de él, trabaja como operario de limpieza para una institución del estado, el es soltero no tiene hijos aun. Solicita este crédito para  cambiar otra parte del techo de su vivienda, el cual se encuentra en mal estado, de esta manera poco a poco va mejorando las condiciones necesarias para vivir en armonía junto a su familia.
texts.en: Jose Ramon is a young man who has not stopped supporting his mother and siblings now that all of them depend on him financially.  He works as a cleaning person for a state agency, is single and has no children.  He is asking for a loan to replace another part of the roof on his house, which is in bad state and in this way, little by little, improve his living conditions to live in harmony with his family.

loans.use: to repair his roof.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: martina de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura su principal cultivo es la espinaca y la mora, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Martinas esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, insecticidas, foliceres, etc. para poder obtener una mejor cosecha y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martina is 42 years old and lives in a home of her own with her family.  She has been a farmer for several years and raises spinach and mulberry and sells her products in the markets near her home.  She pays her expenses with her profits.

Martina is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides, “foliceres,” etc. so she can have a better harvest and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Co Luong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, a 55-year-old woman, is the team leader of the Co Luong Group which consists of six Thai ladies. She works as a farmer with plenty of agriculture activities, such as: cultivating rice, vegetables, corn and breeding pigs, chickens and fish. 

She is living with five other members of her family, including her husband, a son and his wife, who are also farmers, and her two grandchildren who are in secondary school. 

This is her 4th loan cycle in the Anh Chi Em Program. She said that the loans in previous cycles, which she used to invest in breeding pigs, brought high profits to her business. However, several months ago she faced the difficulty of foot-and-mouth disease in her pigs and lost income from the pigs. This time, she wants to use a portion of the loan to buy piglets. 

She hopes that through this loan and the training from Anh Chi Em, she could earn a higher income for her family so that her grandchildren could attend school fully and go to college in the future.

In the picture, Huong is holding a herbaceous branch.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: La promotrice est nommée Khady, c’est une commerçante et coiffeuse en même temps. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite dans un quartier qui est à coté du guichet. Elle s’active dans  la commercialisation d’habits pour homme.  Khady fait aussi de la coiffure.  Elle demande ce crédit d’un montant de 150.000 pour relancer son activité .Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h du soir. Elle a une expérience de plus de plus de 10ans dans cette activité.
texts.en: Khady is a retailer and a hairdresser. She is married and a mother. She lives in a neighborhood next to the UIMCEC branch. She sells menswear. She also cuts and styles hair. She is requesting this 150 000 franc loan in order to restart her business. She supports her husband with the daily expenses and her children's education. She starts her workday at 8 in the morning and ends it at 7 in the evening. She has over 10 years experience in her line of work.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Limamou

texts.fr: Monsieur Limamou est un aviculteur de profession qui évolue dans la commercialisation des accessoires de téléphones  portables, réparation et décodage. Il est marié et père de famille qui prend en charges les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  Il demande ce montant pour renforcer son fond de roulement. Limamou est à son 6ème prêt et commence sa journée à 8h et la termine à 19h. Il a une expérience de plus de 10ans. A l’avenir il voudrait augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Limamou is a poultry farmer who also repairs and reprograms mobile phones and sells phone accessories. He is married and a father and covers the daily expenses of his family and his children's education costs. He is requesting this loan in order to strengthen his working capital. Limamou is on his 6th loan. He starts his workday at 8 in the morning and ends it at 7 at night. He has over 10 years experience in his line of work. In the future, he would like to increase his revenues so that he can improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Ketilut

texts.es:
Ketilut tiene 36 años, es una mujer emprendedora y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 10 y 3 años de edad junto a su esposo Ángel con quienes vive en su casa propia. El negocio de Ketilut consiste en la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, condimentos, embutidos, leche, huevos, bebidas, golosinas y otros. Todos los días desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su tienda para atender a sus clientes que llegan en busca de algún producto con la seguridad que ahí encontrarán lo que necesitan. Su bodega es la más surtida de su barrio y sus clientes no dudan en comprarle, no solo por ese motivo, sino también por la calidad de las marcas de los artículos que ofrece, además de eso el trato tan cordial y la amabilidad que expresa en cada una de sus palabras son la cualidades perfectas para que sus clientes estén siempre agradecidos. Lleva en este negocio 10 años y siempre recibe la ayuda de su cónyuge e hijos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, es una socia muy responsable y solidaria dentro de su grupo, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual con sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos con los que implementará su tienda de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, huevos, fideos, verduras, frutas y otros artículos.
texts.en:
Ketilut is 36 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman and has three children, ages 19, 10, and 3. She lives with her children and her husband Ángel in their own house. Ketilut's business is selling basic food products such as rice, sugar, condiments, sausages, milk, eggs, beverages, candies, and other items. Every day at a very early hour, she opens the doors of her store to wait on her customers, who arrive in search of some product, with the certainty that there they will find what they need. Her store is the best stocked in her neighborhood, and her customers don't hesitate to buy from her, not only for this reason, but also because of the quality of the brands of the items that she offers. In addition to this, her very cordial treatment and the friendliness that she expresses in each one of her words are the perfect qualities to make her customers always appreciative. She has been in this business for 10 years and always receives the assistance of her husband and children. 

At this time she is applying for 1000 PEN. She is a very responsible and supportive member of her loan group. She is grateful to those who offer her the loan, which she needs in order to continue developing her business. She is confident that she will continue being a loan customer who is very punctual with her payments.

With the amount she has applied for, she will buy a larger quantity of products such as rice, sugar, eggs, pasta, vegetables, fruits, and other items, with which she will stock her store.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, sugar, eggs, pasta, vegetables, fruits, and other items to stock her store

loans.name: Leon

texts.en:
Leon is a Cameroonian who is 44 years old and married, with 15 children. The oldest is 23 and in the university, while the youngest is 2 months old. 

He has been in his business for more than 24 years, which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers.

This loan will increase his monthly turnover from XAF 320 000 to XAF 520 000. His standard of living will be improved  as well.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Marie Rosalie

texts.fr: Marie Rosalie est une femme de 51 ans mariée mère de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 32 et 23 ans.parmis eux,trois vont encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des fruits(papayes, ananas,citrons, bananes,avocats, etc) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 1 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans le domaine.Toutefois,elle se retrouve souvent en rupture de stocks ceci dû à la demande très élevée de la clientèle,marie aimerai également vendre du crédit de communication à cause de la demande des clients.d'où la nécessité pour elle d'obtenir ce crédit qui lui permettra d'agrandir son activité et de réaliser des bénéfices en plus.ceux ci seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir au besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Rosalie is a 51-year-old woman, married, and the mother of five children between the ages of 23 and 32 years old. Among them, three are still attending school. Marie Rosalie has been a merchant at the local market for one year, and is active in the retail sale of seasonal fruits (papayas, pineapple, lemons, bananas, avocados, etc.). She has a good relationship with her suppliers, and especially with the customers she has acquired over time through her experience this field. 

Nonetheless, she often finds herself out of stock due to very high customer demand. Marie Rosalie would also like to sell communication credits due to customer demand. She has therefore sought this loan, which will allow her to expand her business and increase her income. She plans to use her income to reinvest in her business and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase stock of fresh food (fruit) and airtime

loans.name: Maisa

texts.en:
Maisa was born in 1991. She is married and has two children, and she lives at a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Her husband works as a driver and works in agriculture at the same time. 

Maisa has been running her mini-market for one year. She considers her work as a good source of income to support her family in improving their living conditions. 

Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of food products to raise her sales and profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To stock her mini-market with food products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Relwende De Yaoghin 02 Group

texts.fr:
Mme FRANCELINE est responsable du groupe RELWENDE DE YAOGHIN 02. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des légumes depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 02bidons de 20l d’huile et 10cartons de macaronis.
Mme veut épargner   ses bénéfices et réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Franceline is the head of the Relwende de Yaoghin 02 group. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 14 years and the youngest is five. Three of her children are in school. 

Franceline has been selling vegetables for ten years. She buys her supplies at the local market. She has both male and female customers.

Franceline would like to buy two 20-litre cans of oil and ten boxes of macaroni. She would like to save her profits and reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy two 20-litre cans of oil and ten boxes of macaroni.

loans.name: Evelyn Carolina

texts.es: evelyn de 42 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en su lugar de su residencia ella quiere surtir aun mas su negocio por eso quiere realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Evelyn is 42 years old and lives with her husband in a home of her own.  She has a store when she sells primary needs products such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other things.  She has been doing this for many years and she has lots of experience in sales, which has provided her better earnings.  Her store is in her house and she wants to stock it but needs more capital, so she is asking for a loan so she can stock her store.  She is certain that she can pay off her debt and is certain that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: Reyna es una jovencita de 23 años, habita en el municipio de Juigalpa, es  madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 4 añitos de edad quien está empezando a estudiar sus primeros niveles en una escuela pública, Reyna  intenta salir adelante con su pequeño negocio de pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación, esta es su primer experiencia de crédito que solicita con el fin de invertir con mas productos para ofrecer a su clientela, de esta manera mejorar las ventas y cubrir sus gastos diarios del hogar, siendo su único sustento este pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is a young woman of 23. She lives in the town of Juigalpa. She is a single mother of a 4-year old son who is just starting his schooling at a public school. Reyna tries to support herself with her small convenience store, located in her home. 

This is her first time requesting a loan. She plans to use the loan to purchase more products to offer to her customers, which will improve sales and cover her daily household expenses. This small business is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, oil, dairy products, meats, cereals, pastries, and soft drinks, among other items.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan José tiene 48 años de edad, su familia la conforma su esposa y 4 hijos quienes dependen únicamente de él y los apoya con sus estudios, labora como cadete de taxi, a diario sale muy temprano en las mañanas en busca de pasajeros para poder ganarse sus centavos para  mantener las gastos del hogar, este crédito que solicita es para comprar materiales como cemento, arena y el pago de la mano de obra para el  repello de las paredes de su vivienda que poco a poco con muchos esfuerzos ha venido haciendo, para brindarle mejores condiciones a su familia en el hogar.
texts.en:
Juan José is 48 years old. His family includes his wife and four children that depend on him. He supports his children in their education. He works as a taxi driver. He leaves very early in the morning every day in search of passengers, in order to earn enough money to pay for household expenses. 

Juan José is requesting this loan in order to buy materials such as cement and sand, and to pay for the labor required to plaster the walls of his home (which he has built gradually and with much effort) and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Zulley Alejandra

texts.es:
Ella es zulley alejandra, vive en bogota y esta estudiando auxiliar de enfermería en campo alto, paso a segundo semestre, le  gusta mucho todo lo relacionado con la salud, el sueño es ser psiquiatra, pero la carrera es muy larga, primero toca estudiar medicina y luego psicología, no tiene los medios suficientes para estudiar medicina , por eso le toco empezar como todas la gente luchadora, desde abajo para ir ascendiendo poco apoco para si llegar a el sueño primordial de ser una excelente psiquiatra. 
Tal vez el sueño es algo difícil de cumplir le va a llevar un largo tiempo, pero bueno el que no sueña no tiene expectativas y el que no tiene expectativas no tiene una meta.
No tiene los medios económicos suficientes para pagar la carrera, en este momento que es auxiliar de enfermería los papas viven separados y ella vive con la mama, la mama es  estilista y en este momento el que las ayuda es el padrastro, el papa trabaja, pero tiene muchos gastos y la verdad no tiene como ayudarla en este momento, ella trabaja como mesera en un asadero y a si planea pagar los estudios, pero es realista y sabe que este trabajo no le dura mucho y ya que todavía no es mayor de edad, no conseguirá un trabajo serio y fijo.
Lo que mas quiere es seguir estudiando, ya que la ignorancia y la pobreza se supera con el estudio y sabe que ay algo para ella importante afuera.
Por eso quiere seguir estudiando, necesita el convenio con kiva, porque la verdad le gusta ese descuento, le ayudaría mucho, le sirve mucho y sabe que trabajando a si sea lavando platos conseguirá culminar los estudios.
Esta muy contenta de que no va hacer fácil, pero también es consciente de que si no lucha no puede hacer realidad los sueños, ya se graduó de bachiller, ya tiene 1 semestre en enfermería, sabe que puede seguir adelante, pero no sola, la gente no sale adelante sola, siempre ay la ayuda de alguien, algún apoyo a si sea moral económicamente, ella le pide a kiva que le ayude con el apoyo económico, que el apoyo moral ella lo tiene.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que le están brindando a ella y a jóvenes , no solo le están invirtiendo dinero a los jóvenes si no al futuro, con mejor profesional de colombia, gente que quiere salir adelante y empresa, entidad, que lo apoyan para hacer el sueño que para mucha gente es imposible.
Da garantía de que lo que se invierte en ella sea tiempo o dinero no se perderá ni un poco, ella no es perfecta, pero es muy persistente y no se rinde con facilidad ella solo lucha y lucha hasta que ya no pueda ser mas profesional.
texts.en:
Zulley Alejandra lives in Bogotá, where she is in her second semester at CampoAlto, studying to be a nursing assistant.  She very much likes everything related to health, and her dream is to be a psychiatrist.  But the process is long: first she has to study medicine, and then psychology, and she does not have the means to study medicine. So, like many people, she will have to start at the bottom and work her way up little by little, until she realizes her ultimate dream of becoming an excellent psychiatrist. 

Although fulfilling this dream may be difficult and take a long time, a person must have a dream in order to have hopes and goals, so she will be a nursing assistant for now, as she does not have the economic means to pay for this degree.  Her parents are separated, and she lives with her mother, who is a stylist.  Her stepfather helps them, because her father, although working, has a lot of expenses and cannot help them at the moment.  She works as a waitress in an asadero (a barbecue restaurant that serves a variety of grilled meats, poultry, and other regional dishes). This way, she plans on paying her tuition, but she is a realistic person, and she knows that this is not a long-term job. And, because she is not yet legally of age, she won't be able find work that is permanent and secure. 

What she wants most is to continue studying, as education is the way to overcome ignorance and poverty, and she knows that there is something important out there for her. This is why she wants to continue to study, and she needs the agreement with Kiva; a Kiva loan would help her very much.

She knows that by working, even as a dishwasher, she will manage to complete her studies, and she knows it won't be easy. But she is also aware that if she doesn't fight, she cannot turn her dreams into reality. She already has her high-school diploma and she already has one semester of nursing studies. She knows that she can continue to move forward, but not alone. People don't move forward alone; there is always support from someone, either moral or economic. She has moral support, and she is asking Kiva for economic support. 

She is grateful for the opportunity that Kiva lenders are giving to her and to other young people. Not only are they investing in young people, but also in the future.  With better work in Colombia, there will be support for people who want to move forward, and for their endeavors, a dream that is impossible for many. 

She promises that anything invested in her, be it time or money, will not be wasted. She is not perfect, but she is very persistent, and she does not give up easily.  She will fight and fight until she is a complete professional.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Sarxan

texts.en:
Sarxan is 28 years old, married, and living with his parents and wife in the Baku region. His mother is a housewife, his father is a bus driver, and Sarxan is a master. He sets plastic and wooden doors and windows.

His wife is pregnant, and in the new year, his child will be born. He wants to provide  a better future for child. 

Sarxan wants to increase his business and monthly income, so he applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

With this loan he wants to buy a new apparatus (for establishing and cutting) which will be useful in his business. 

He is thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations for help. 

In the future, Sarxan wants to hire an assistant for his business.

loans.use: to buy a new apparatus for establishing and cutting doors and windows

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their small house in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. His wife, Budmandah, used to be obstetrician and lately they have been running various types of businesses to increase their family income.

Enhbayar has been running a welding and blacksmith type business at home during the summer since 1990. He graduated as a translator and interpreter and works part-time at a tourist camp as a driver/translator during the tourist season. He has built a small workshop on their plot of land to prevent his business from being seasonal because of the weather. 

His wife used to run a small Internet cafe in their spare room last year, and now she is planning to start a small grocery store in that room.

He is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for his wife's new grocery store. The Enhbayar's are hardworking and diligent people.

In the picture: Enhbayar (making metal stove)

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for his wife's new grocery store

loans.name: Bonheur Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bukasa est une commerçante depuis  16 ans et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Bonheur», âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse  des  poissons. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 1 sac de poissons. Son conjoint est un Pasteur d’une Église locale. Elle avait commencé ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite achever la construction de sa maison, scolariser et  nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs  non bancable. Il sied de signaler que certains  clients portent leur bébés.
texts.en:
Bukasa is a member of the business group 'Bonheur' and has been a fish retailer for sixteen years.  She is 48 years old, married and mother to eight children, who all attend school.

Bukasa has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to increase her business.  She will use her loan to buy one bag of fish.

Bukasa's husband is the Pastor at a local Church.  She started her business with funds given to her by her husband.

In the future, Bukasa would like to finish building her house, and feed and educate her children.

She would like to thank Hekima for the support which they give to non-bankable women entrepreneurs.  It should be noted that some of the clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy one bag of fish to sell.

loans.name: Upendo Kahembe Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mukerimonza est une  brave commerçante d’une expérience de  plus de 20 ans et membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Upendo kahembe» âgée de 76 ans, responsable et mère de 8 enfants qui tous, sont déjà  mariés. Elle est vendeuse de divers articles de boutique. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle va acheter 1 sac du sucre, 2 cartons de savons, 2 sacs de sel, 3 cartons de tomates en boite. Au début, elle avait reçu de fonds de son ancien mari. Elle souhaite construire sa maison et scolariser ses  petits fils. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur donnant de microcrédit sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: The customer, Mukerimonza, is a courageous businesswoman with more than 20 years' experience and a member of the Upendo Kahembe business association. She is 76 years old and a mother to eight children who are already married but remain her dependents. She sells various shop products and is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy a sack of sugar, two cartons of soaps, two sacks of salt and three cartons of canned tomatoes. She was given the capital to begin her business by her former husband. She would like to be able to build her own house and cover the education of her grandsons. She is grateful to Hekima for its support through microloans without any material guarantees to female entrepreneurs, who do not have access to classic bank loans.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, two cartons of soap, two sacks of iodine salt, three cartons of canned tomotoes.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine runs a small store in Goris town. It is a general store where Armine trades different products (food, home supplies, etc.). Armine is a mother of three school aged children (ages 8, 13 and 16). She and her husband work hard to sustain their living and cover the family's daily expenses. Due to her nice attitude towards people, she has attracted a lot of clients. 

Currently, Armine is asking for this loan to purchase a new stock of supplies and sell them in her store. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Armine to be able to meet her clients' current demands and earn higher income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for supplies (home supplies, food) to sell in her store

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari is a young farmer from Zangakatun village of the Vayots Dzor region. She lives with her husband and parents-in-law. Mari's husband is a contractual serviceman, and her father-in-law works in the village's local secondary school. All the family works hard to earn a living.  

With help of her family members, Mari is engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding sheep, and in the cultivation of alfalfa, cherries, apples and walnuts. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. 

The barn of the livestock is currently in poor condition and needs to be renovated. Besides this, the family's agribusiness needs some investments to be ready for the winter. A loan of USD 3,000 will help this young, hardworking woman and her family greatly, enabling them to renovate the barn, to purchase some forage for the livestock, and to pay for the harvesting services.

loans.use: to renovate the barn, to purchase some forage for the livestock and to pay for the harvesting services.

loans.name: Outifafa Group

texts.en:
These women are part of a group called "Outifafa" and engage in the sale of provisions, soft drinks, frozen fish and meat, eggs, and football jerseys. The group is made up of women who are very familiar with ID Ghana's program. They are very active in their businesses, which are small retail operations. They all live in the same neighborhood and enjoy good relations.

Mercy (second from the left in the picture) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and has one child. She sells football jerseys and track suits for schools, football teams, and the public in Accra. She plans to use her new loan amount of 1,500 Ghanaian cedis (GHS) to offer her customers different types of jerseys so they have multiple choices. She wants to use the profits she makes to build up more substantial savings, which will enable her to ask for a much bigger loan, so that she can expand her business and be better able to take care of her child.

The women need a total of 5,600 GHS to expand their businesses.

loans.use: offer her customers different types of jerseys so they have multiple choices.

loans.name: Hamda Nouh

texts.en: Hamda Nouh is 23 years old. She studies at Adna University in the faculty of medicine.  Her main challenge is the lack of a laptop to prepare her graduation thesis book. She requested from Kaaba MFI  a laptop as loan and Kaaba will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments. Now she is waiting for the laptop.  Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan and Hamda will pay monthly repayments. After university, Hamda wants to work as a nurse.

loans.use: buy a laptop for college

loans.name: Holliness

texts.en:
Holliness is married, with three school-going children. They live in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fruits and vegetables stall business for the past year. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer in the future.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Deeqa Nouh

texts.en:
Deeqa Nouh is 19 years old. She is a secondary school student. She wants to start at university as she is finishing her school this year. 

Deega Nouh needs a laptop and she requested a laptop as loan from Kaaba, which she will pay for in installments. Now she is waiting for the laptop. Deeqa  likes to learn business administration and after university hopes to work in admin and finance.

loans.use: buy a laptop for college

loans.name: Burbuqe

texts.en:
Burbuqe is a 34-year-old divorced mother of two children; 16 and 14. They are members of the vulnerable ethnic Egyptians and they live in the outskirts of a main city in central Albania that is inhabited only by ethnics. They live under very poor conditions and Burbuqe is one of them; the photograph of her says it all about their community’s living conditions including hygiene and nutrition. Some members have done well during these past twenty years and have moved out of their community, while others are stilll struggling in almost all areas.

Burbuqe works as a janitor in a hospital. She wants to do some home repairing with this loan that will be her first one. She is asking for your compassion and generosity.

loans.use: to make some minor repairs to her home

loans.name: Ban Kha Group

texts.en:
Phien is 34-years-old and she lives with her husband, along with her 10-year-old son. They are Thai minority and live in an old temporary house. 

Phien has been a farmer since she was a child.  Presently, she works at lots of agriculture production including cultivating rice, vegetables, raising chickens and pigs, which brings a monthly income of approximately VND 5,000,000. Not only that, her husband also works in construction for local employers to have enough money for living expenses and make some savings for rebuilding the house. She said she would use the loan this cycle from Anh Chi Em to buy food and vaccines for pigs. She hopes that after using the loan and the knowledge from ACE training, she could improve her family income. 

Phien and her partner are both illiterate, they do not want their child to be a farmer. She dreams that her kid would become an officer working in state. 

In the picture, Phien is wearing a wool cap with a branch in her hands.

loans.use: to buy food and vaccines for pigs

loans.name: Tan Binh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Anh is a 42-year-old Thai lady working as a farmer. She lives with her husband who is also a farmer, along with her school aged child. 

To cover living expenses and her child's tuition fee, she works at many agriculture activities, including cultivating rice, vegetables and breeding chickens, pigs, fish and buffalo. Fish-farming has brought a high profit for her business, so in this loan cycle of Anh Chi Em Program, she wants to use a portion of the loan to buy small fish. She said that she is grateful to farming and the breeding technique support, as well as the previous loan from Anh Chi Em, because thanks to them, she dealt with the problem of lack of capital and understanding agriculture. 

She hopes her family will be more abundant in life and her child will go to college in the future.  In the picture, Anh is wearing a yellow sweater.

loans.use: to buy small fish

loans.name: Victor

texts.ru:
Викторсопытный фермер. Уже 20 лет он занимается выращиванием овощей и это самый прибыльный бизнес в его селе. На своем участке   за это время он построил несколько теплиц, где выращивает редис и помидоры. Виктор уверен, что успех зависит от его трудолюбия, поэтому все силы и средства вкладывает в развитие бизнеса. Хорошие помощники его семья- жена и дети.

Неожиданно Виктору предложили купить земельный участок, рядом с его домом. Виктор обратился за кредитом в 40,000 гривен. Это хорошая возможность расширить бизнес ведь  на участке уже  есть две теплицы и весной Виктор сможет посадить больше помидор.
texts.en: Victor is a highly experienced farmer.  He has been involved in growing vegetables, which is the most profitable business in his village, for 20 years.  Over this period of time, he built several greenhouses, where he grows radishes and tomatoes.  Victor is certain that success is dependent on his hard work and this is why he invests all of his strengths and means into developing the business.  His family - wife and children - are good helpers.  Suddenly, Victor received an offer to purchase land near his house.  Victor requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 hryvnia.  This is a good opportunity to expand his business because this land already has two greenhouses, and Victor will be able to plant more tomatoes there in the spring.

loans.use: to purchase a plot with two green houses

loans.name: Nurida

texts.en: Nurida is a seller. She is 57 years old, married for 37 years, and has three children. Her family is made up of IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now they live in the Baku region. Her husband is a butcher. The eldest son and daughter are married; the youngest son, a bus driver, is single and lives with Nurida. Nurida sells vegetables and fruits in the local area. Today, she needs a loan in the amount of 1200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy additional vegetables and fruits. She is thankful to the Komak Credit Union and Kiva organizations for help. In the future, she wants to open a store.

loans.use: to buy a additional vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is 33 years old, single and lives with her parents. Her father is a master and her mother is a housewife. She helps Sevda in her business. Sevda has been in the farming business for five years. She plants tomatoes. Now, she plans to increase her business. For this reason, she needs a loan amount of 1,700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, she wants to buy seed, seedlings and fertilizer. 

Sevda is thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations for a loan. In the future, she wants to build a big greenhouse for an increase in her business. And in her personal life, she wants to get married and to have children.

loans.use: to buy seed, seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.ru: Назирчону 23 года. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Нозирчон как и любой мужчина любящий свою семью всегда старается обеспечить жене и детям достойные жилищные условия, еду, образование и здравоохранение. Назирчон занимается скотоводством. У него есть корова, она обеспечивает его детей молоком. Назирчон за счет кредита хочет увеличить поголовья скотов, чтобы развить бизнес и строить светлое будущее для себя и своей семьи. Это особенно важно в Таджикистане, самой бедной стране в Центральной Азии, где более двух третей населения живет ниже черты бедности. Назирчон хочет доказать, что он хороший муж и отец, и он обеспечит своей семье хорошую жизнь.
texts.en: Nazirjon is 23 years old and he is married with two children.  Like any man, he loves his family and always tries to provide his wife and children with decent living conditions, food, education and good health.  Nazirjon raises livestock; he has a cow which gives milk to his children.  He wants to use this loan to increase his head of livestock so he can then increase his business and build a bright future for himself and his family.  This is especially important in Tajikistan, the poorest country in Central Asia, where more than 2/3 of the population live below the poverty line.  Nazirjon wants to show that he is a good man and father and he wants to provide his family with a good life.

loans.use: to buy a pair of cows

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is from Yerevan, where she lives with her parents. She is a student in her 4th year of study at the Russian-Armenian Slavonic University. Elina is a very hardworking student who does her best to get a good education and to become a good specialist. Elina's parents work locally but they hardly manage to cover the family's basic needs. Elina has applied for this loan to purchase her university tuition and to continue her education, She will be very grateful to lenders if they help her to cover tuition costs and to get her higher education degree. She waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en: Melanya is a young farmer from the village of Hovtun in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband, two little daughters (4 and 2 years old), and her mother-in-law. Melanya's husband is a contractual serviceman and her mother-in-law works at the village self-governance body. They are the main breadwinners of the family and work really hard to earn a living. To assist her family members in meeting the basic needs of the family Melanya is engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding sheep, and in the cultivation of wheat and grass. With the help if her husband and mother-in-law, she sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of family's income. Melanya's agribusiness currently needs some investments in order to function in an efficient and productive way. She needs a loan of 2,500 USD to purchase wheels for agricultural machinery, to renovate agricultural machinery, and to make previous credit repayments. She and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheels for agricultural machinery, to renovate agricultural machinery, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Munarbek

texts.ru: Мунарбек 37 лет, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 4 детей. У Мунарбека - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мунарбек занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мунарбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 нетель, 4 овцы, 5 коз, а также имеет сад, где растут яблони и сливы. После сбора урожая Мунарбек реализует яблоки и сливу на рынке оптовым покупателям. Урожай приносит небольшой доход. Также в свободное время Мунарбек  таксует, то есть предоставляет услуги такси местному населению. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мунарбек обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мунарбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Munarbek is 37 years old, married, and together with his wife, is raising four children. Munarbek has a secondary education. As the main source of income for his family, Munarbek practices livestock breeding. He started this business 10 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Munarbek's hard work, he currently has 1 mare, 4 sheep, and 5 goats on his farm, as well as a garden in which he grows apples and plums. After gathering his harvest, Munarbek sells these apples and plums on the market to wholesale buyers. His harvest brings in a small profit. In his spare time, Munarbek also works as a taxi driver, offering his taxi services to the local population. His monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing his business, Munarbek turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." He is requesting a loan to buy horses to increase the size of his herd. Munarbek plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy horses.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Ijevan town. She is married with a 5-years-old daughter. Together with her husband, Mariam has been involved in a retail business. With the truck that her husband owns, Mariam organizes the retail business. She trades with vegetables and fruits, which she sells in the open market. 

Mariam and her husband work really hard to be able to sustain their young family. Currently, because of the hard financial times that family is facing, Mariam needs support. She asks for this loan to be able to renovate the truck by which they organize the retail business, and purchase vegetables to be able to increase sales.

Mariam has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Mariam will be very grateful to all lenders for supporting her with the business.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the truck and purchase vegetables for reselling.

loans.name: Albert

texts.fr: Albert est un homme de 39 ans père 8 enfants dont l'age varie entre 02 et 13 ans. Cinq de ses enfants vont à l'école. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 02 ans où il vend la friperie chaussure des jeunes, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les chaussures qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Albert is a 39-year-old father of eight children whose ages are between 2 and 13 years. Five of his children go to school. 

For the past two years, he has been a trader in a local market place where he sells second-hand shoes for young people, men and women (according to the season and bales available). Because of his small capital, he is forced to go to jumble sales every weekend to buy shoes at retail price, which he then displays on his stall. This does not really earn him much money so it is important for him to get a loan for his business so he is able to get a large bundle of mixed shoes. 

He will save the profit he makes as a result of the loan to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy a bale of shoes

loans.name: Oulèye

texts.fr:
Madame Oulèye, une dame de 45 ans, évolue dans  le secteur de la vente de céréale local. Elle pratique le métier depuis plus de 10 ans et a démarré avec presque rien comme capital. Elle prenait la marchandise à crédit et après avoir vendu, elle  reversait à son fournisseur. Cette transaction était due au manque de moyen immédiat ; depuis qu’elle a entendu parler d’IMCEC, elle est venue solliciter un appui financier pour ne plus être confronté à cette situation difficile. Avec l’argent, elle pourra acheter du mil, des arachides, du mais pour revendre.
Madame Oulèye est mariée et elle participe à la dépense quotidienne du foyer.
Elle désire ouvrir un grand magasin où elle pourra stocker en quantité suffisante les céréales qu’elle vend.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ouleye is a 45-year-old woman. She works as a trader of local cereals. She has been in the business for over 10 years and started with barely any capital. She took her merchandise on credit and after having sold it, she repaid her supplier. This deal was made because she lacked immediate financial resources; since she heard about IMCEC, she came to request financial support so she won’t have to face this difficult situation again.

With the money she will be able to buy millet, peanuts, and corn to sell. 
Mrs. Ouleye is married and provides for the daily expenses of the family. 
She would like to open a large shop where she could stock up on large quantity of cereals for resell.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resell: millet, peanuts and corn

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su familia conformada por sus cuatro hijo. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, desde hace varios años posee una tortillería, gracias a ello su hogar nunca ha faltado el pan de cada día. Ana desea ampliar más su negocio es decir comprar mas suministros que le permitan tener su negocio mas rentable es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un prestamos para comprar maíz y cal para mantener siempre esa clientela que tiene. Ella espera que la ayuda sea recibida y que pronto su calidad de vida mejore.
texts.en:
Ana is a 39-year old woman who lives in her own house with her four children. She is very hard-working, honest and responsible. She has run her tortilla making business for several years, thanks to which she has been able to provide for her family.

Ana wants to expand her business and buy additional supplies to make it more profitable. This is why she is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL, a loan that she will use to buy corn and lime, so that she can keep her current clientele. She expects to receive this financial support and to see their quality of life improved.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Doña dolores de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace 4 años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de sus dos hijos logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Dolores solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Dolores is a 65-year old woman who lives in her own house with her two sons. She has made a living selling tortillas at her home for 4 years and works Monday through Sunday. She has many clients thanks to her hard work and kindness. They manage to cover household expenses with her income and her sons' help. 

Doña Dolores is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk to make the tortillas. She expects to increase her income and to improve their financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 26 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes;la clienta es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. ella asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
The borrower is a 26-year old woman who lives with her partner and their son in their own house. She has worked selling clothes for several years and has extensive experience in the business, which allows her to obtain the best income. Her business is located in the market near their house and has many clients. Clients know that her items are of good quality at reasonable prices and that she offers an incomparable service (always available and meeting their needs). 

The borrower is an entrepreneur, very involved with her job and a fighter. Demand has increased in the last few weeks and she wants to make a new investment; however, she does not have enough capital to invest, which is why she is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL. She will use the loan to buy clothes in bulk and promises to repay. She hopes to bring financial stability to her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo es un hombre de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Domingo no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios y eso lo imposibilito a estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Domingo se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene una pequeña parcela donde cultiva plátano, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas,Domingo se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y experiencia.
Domingo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de abono, riego y cosecha de su cultivo, así pues Domingo seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran agricultor.
texts.en:
Domingo is a 51-year-old man who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and their three children. He is a hard and enthusiastic worker who, along with his wife, dedicates all of his efforts to getting the family ahead. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources, Domingo had to begin working at a very young age and could not finish primary school, which made it impossible to study a professional career.

Through his own initiative Domingo began working as a farmer. He has a small piece of land where he grows plantains. He begins work in the early morning each day and continues work for approximately 10 hours. Domingo takes pleasure in his work and thinks that it is going well because of his dedication and experience. Domingo is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to the help they have provided he will cover the costs of fertilizer, irrigation and harvest of his crops. He will keep working and exerting himself to achieve his greatest ambition of being a great farmer.

loans.use: to cover the costs of maintaining his crop.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 55 years old. She is married and lives with her three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling groceries for more than a year, earning approximately $3 a day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $15 each day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Chantha is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix her house.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en:
Cecilio is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy the spare parts and accessories for his tricycle. His loan also helped in the education of his child, while his income assisted his family's everyday expenses. His wife is also helping him to provide for their family.
 
He would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Cecilio dreams that his business will continue to grow and hopes that his family is always in good condition. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her computers for her internet business.

Miraflor has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from buying and selling ladies' bags.

Miraflor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her computers.

loans.name: Osman Hassan

texts.en:
Osman Hassan is 27 years old. He has finished studying at the University of Hargeisa, Faculty of Information Technology. 

Osman Hassan now works for the Ministry of Labor and Social Affairs. He needs a laptop to prepare IT Programmes and he is unable to pay the money all at once. He approached Kaaba MFI and requested a laptop as a loan. Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. He is now waiting for the laptop.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for work purposes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 44 years old, and is married with five children. He is from Iraq and is the only provider for his family.
 
Ahmad owns a small shop selling spare parts for various types of cars. He established his business in 2009 and has one employee. He has good experience in the field, and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
 
Ahmad is requesting a loan of $2500, which he will use to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventory. He wants to expand his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Ezechiel

texts.en:
Ezechiel is 50 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have ten children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Guzal

texts.en:
Guzal is a sociable woman. She's 27 years old, she's married and has children. She lives with her ​​husband and children in the village in Spitamen region. She loves her region, because there grow the most beneficial and tasty fruits that are rich in good vitamins. These ripe and juicy fruits can be traded on the market. This activity is quite popular in the area where Guzal lives .
 
Guzal also sells fruit. She started this business activity recently when her husband left for work in Russia and began sending Guzal money. Guzal was economical with the money, and was saving little by little . After having accumulated the necessary amount she started selling fruit in the market. Things are going well Guzal and she decided to expand her business .
 
With the coming holiday months, Guzal wants to increase her inventory and assortment by including a mix of tropical fruits. To obtain a loan Guzal applied to MDO "Arvand ". She is hopeful that she will get help and financial support.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of tropical fruits for holiday season

loans.name: Bertille

texts.fr: Bertille est une femme de 45 ans fiancée et mère 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 05 et 12 ans. Tous vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 01 an où elle vend la friperie es vêtements des jeunes, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, elle est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les vêtements qu'elle expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. ce qui augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi ses bénéfices. bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bertille is a 45-year-old woman who is engaged. She is the mother of three children between the ages of 5 and 12 years old. All of her children go to school.

She has been a merchant in a local market for a year where she sells used clothing as well as children's, men, and women's clothing (depending on the season and bundle). Due to her limited capital, she has to go to the outlets each weekend to buy clothing at retail that she will display at her stall. 

This does not yield a lot - thus the importance of the loan for her business. This will allow her to buy a mixed bundle, which will help her increase not only her sales, but also her profits. Part of the profits will be reinvested in her business for growth, and the rest will allow her to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: buy a bundle of clothing.

loans.name: Abdoulaye Dioum

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye  habite à coté du guichet, marié et père de famille il évolue dans l’artisanat. Il sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 400.000F  pour acheter du fer et de l’aluminium pour la fabrication des marmites. Il gère les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il a une expérience de plus de 20ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h. A l’avenir il souhaite avoir une usine de production en marmites et aluminium pour avoir le monopole du marché. Ainsi il pourra épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et rénover sa maison.
texts.en:
Monsieur Abdoulaye lives next to the branch office. He is married and a father. 

He is developing his craft. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 400,000F in order to buy iron and aluminum to make cooking pots. He manages his family's daily expenses as well as the schooling fees for his children.

He has more than 20 years experience in his business. He starts working at 9 am and stops at 6pm. In the future, he would like to have a aluminum pot factory so that he could have a monopoly on the market. That way, he could save money, improve his family's living conditions, and renovate his home.

loans.use: buy iron and aluminum to make cooking pots.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr: Les sept femmes du groupe Yiriwa sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Moussokorobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce des condiments, de savons, et de mil. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Coumba  (femme assise tasse en plastique sur le pied dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment et de savons dans le village de Moussokorobougou et environ. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  8 paniers de tomate pour  la satisfaction du besoin de sa clientèle. La revente se fait au comptant à la maison et au marché du village à une clientèle mixe. Madame Coumba  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 6.000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des petits  besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
