The majority of the seven women in the Yiriwa group are married to monogamous husbands. They average 45 years of age with three children each, and they all live in the village of Moussokorobougou in the Ségou region (Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through neighbors, relatives and their income-generating activities in the village. They have small businesses selling condiments, soaps and millet.

With a view to expanding their businesses, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Coumba (the woman in the photo who is sitting down with a plastic cup at her feet) is a big seller of condiments and soaps in the village of Moussokorobougou and the surrounding areas. She is planning to use her loan to buy eight baskets of tomatoes so that she can satisfy her customers' needs. She sells her products for cash at home and in the village market to a mixed customer base. Coumba hopes to make an average monthly profit of 6,000FCFA with this loan which will be used to provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Halako

texts.en:
Halako is a mother and has children. She stays at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the school fees for her children. 

For the past years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other fruit sellers. 

With the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits at wholesale and resell them at a profit. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits at wholesale and resell them at a profit.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As the married mother of two children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Vilma is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 38 años de edad posee una tienda donde vende frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, golosinas, margarinas, aceite, etc. tiene 3 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas lo prefieren y lo mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, ; Manuel es un hombre dedicado a su labor, como todo buen comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. él tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, 38, owns a store where he sells beans, milk, eggs, bread, sweets, margarine, oil and so on. He has been working for three years in his business and it has given him the experience in sales to enable him to earn a larger income. His store is located in his place of residence in an area with high footfall. He has accrued a large customer base as the store is well stocked, which people prefer, and it keeps him ahead of the competition as he always has what they need, with a quality product at accessible prices and with an unequaled service always meeting the customers' expectations.

Manuel is a man who is dedicated to his work, as any good salesperson, he wants to grow the business and make a new investment but he needs capital, which is why he is seeking a loan from Integral to buy bulk grains, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks and so on. He has good credit history and pledges to repay the loan, and he also asserts that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks and so on.

loans.name: Juana Gladis

texts.es: Juana de 38 años de edad vive con sus hijos. Ella tiene una venta de productos de uso personal como cremas, perfumes, shampoo, lociones, etc. es muy conocida en la zona y posee muchos clientes pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles; Juana es una mujer honrada y muy dedicada a su trabajo, ella decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas productos por mayor para seguir con su negocio, junana tiene la esperanza que así podrá llevar a su hogar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana, 38, lives with her children. She has a business selling personal products such as creams, perfumes, shampoo, lotions, and so on. She is well known in the area and has a lot of customers as everything that she sells is of good quality and at truly accessible prices. Juana is a person of integrity who is very dedicated to her work. She decided to seek a loan from Integral to allow her to buy more products in bulk to continue in her business. Juana is hopeful that in this way she will be able to provide her household with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, shampoo, lotions and so on in bulk.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 41-year-old married man who has children that live in Taiz, Yemen. He is a doctor who studied pharmacology science at Taiz University. He has been operating a pharmacy for many years. He is working hard to continually provide income for his family's everyday expenses. 

He would like to expand his business so he took a loan of 200,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB in order to supply his business with good medicine to increase his profit. In the future, he would like to open another pharmacy. He thanks kiva lenders for funding his first loan.

loans.use: to supply his business with good medicine to increase his profit.

loans.name: Wajdan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Wajdan and is comprised of four women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. This community is hardworking, and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER. 

Nabeela is the leader of the group. She is 41 years old. She lives with her children in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her children with a better future. She went through a lot of effort and had to save money with the help of her family to set up her small house. Now she has applied for a loan to buy construction supplies to complete her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet, de 41 años, es una joven mujer alegre y emprendedora, es soltera y tienes 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Janet, consiste en la venta de comida, vende por las noches diversos platos regionales. Su puesto de venta esta ubicado en una esquina muy concurrida cerca de su vivienda. Durante las tardes realiza la preparación de cada uno de los platillos que deleitan el paladar de sus clientes diariamente. Trabaja con ayuda de dos personas más. Ella trabaja en este rubro laboral desde hace 5 años. Le gusta trabajar de esta manera ya que dispone de tiempo para poder hacer varias actividades y así puede darle el tiempo necesario a su pequeño hijo quien a su edad necesita mucho de ella para poder tener una base fuerte de su alimentación, desea mas adelante tener un local en donde acondicionar y empezar a vender en mas grandes cantidades. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente los ingredientes e insumos que necesita para seguir con su trabajo tales como arroz, huevos, aceituna, carne de polo, pescados, y otros.
texts.en: Janet, 41 years old, is very cheerful and enterprising.  She is single and has two children, with whom she lives in her own house.  Janet works selling food.  Each night she sells a diverse range of regional dishes at a stall on a much-frequented corner near to her home.  In the afternoon Janet prepares each of the meals that will delight her customers' taste buds every day.  Janet receives help in her work from two other people.  Janet has now been doing this work for five years and she likes it as she has time to do other activities and to spend the necessary time with her young son.  He is at an age where he needs his mum a lot so that he can be fed well.  In the future Janet would like to have her own premises where she can set up her business and sell in greater quantities.  On this occasion Janet is applying for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles and she is very happy to now that she will have financial support as, this way, she will feel more secure as she progresses with her business.  Janet will use this loan to gradually buy the supplies and ingredients that she needs to continue with her work, such as rice, eggs, olives, chicken, fish, and more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, eggs, olives, chicken, fish, and more.

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr: Madame AÏSSATA est une femme qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite à un quartier  qui est à coté du guichet. Elle est à son 4ème prêt  et demande ce montant pour acheter et revendre des draps. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 10h pour la finir à 18h. A l’avenir elle souhaite voyager à Dubaï et chine pour acheter des marchandises de plus grandes qualités pour avoir plus de bénéfices. Ainsi elle va améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Aïssata is a married mother and lives in a neighborhood next to the branch office. She is on her fourth loan and is requesting this amount so that she can buy and resell sheets. She helps her husband to manage the family's daily outgoings and the cost of their children's education. She begins her day at ten in the morning and finishes at six in the evening. In the future she would like to travel to Dubai and China to be able to buy better quality goods and make more money. In so doing she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheets for resale.

loans.name: Olive

texts.fr: Olive est une femme de 45 ans veuve et père 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 15 et 25 ans. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 07 ans où elle vend la friperie(lingerie pour femmes). son activité fonctionne bien grâce à la clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps e à la bonne qualité de ses  produits. elle juste un problème lié à la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à faire écouler tout son stock avant de se réapprovisionner ce qui cause souvent l'insatisfaction de ses clients fidèle. d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra non seulement d'augmenter le stock de sa lingerie mais aussi son bénéfice. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Olive is a 45-year old widow and mother to four children, whose ages range between 15 and 25 years old. She has been a trader in a local market for the past seven years and sells used clothing (lingerie for woemn) there. Her business is doing well thanks to the customer base she has built up over time and to the good quality of her products. Her only problem is the small size of her capital which means that she has to sell off all her stock before getting in fresh supplies; this means that her loyal customers are often dissatisfied. This loan is thus important for her business as it will allow her not only to increase her stock of lingerie but also her profits. She will save the profits made as a result of this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of lingerie for women.

loans.name: Nicolas Antonio

texts.es: Nicolas de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, él posee una tienda donde vende golosinas, refrescos, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 10 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocido por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, el quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Nicolas, 50, lives in his own home with his wife and their three children; he owns a store where he sells sweets, soft drinks, beans, milk, eggs, bread and so on. He has been working for 10 years in the business and this has given him the experience in sales to obtain larger profits. 

The business is located in his home of residence, Nicolas is well known by the locals in the area, having made a large customer base as he keeps the store well stocked. Nicolas wants to grow the business and make a new investment, hence why he is seeking a loan which enables him to buy what he needs for the store. He pledges to repay the loan and also asserts that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, beans, milk, eggs, bread and so on.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Don alfonso de 61 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa su esposa le ayuda en el negocio desde hace varios años, trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Don alfonso solicta un credito para comprar maiz por mayor para seguir vendiendo las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica junto con su esposa.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 61, makes his living selling tortillas at home. His wife has been helping in the business for several years. He works from Monday to Sunday and has a lot of customers as he is a very hardworking and friendly person. With the profits that he makes, he is able to cover the household expenditure. 

Alfonso is seeking a loan to buy corn in bulk in order to continue selling tortillas and obtain larger profits to have a better level of financial stability with his wife.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Doña catalina de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, Doña Catalina desea comprar mas materia prima como carne, verduras, pollos, frutas, arroz, etc. por mayor para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión,es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hijo lo necesario sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Catalina, 66, lives in her own home with her son, she is a woman who is a fighter and responsible so that her family does not lack anything to get by. For several years now she has been working selling food near her place of residence. She has a lot of permanent customers as she offers her dish of food at a good price. 

Catalina wants to buy more raw materials such as meat, vegetables, chicken, fruit, rice and so on in bulk in order to vary her menu and have a little more money coming in. However, she doesn't have enough income for this investment which is why she is seeking a loan to buy the aforementioned goods and therein obtain better profits to give her son what he needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, chicken, fruit, rice and so on in bulk.

loans.name: Amir Al-Wadi Group

texts.en:
Amir Al-Wadi is a group of four hardworking women from Sana`a, Yemen. They have requested a group loan, and they will hold each other accountable for loan repayment. Ameena, who is 31 years old, is the leader of the group. She is a resourceful and honest woman. She lives with her family in a small house in Sana`a. She is very hardworking and does her best to earn money. However, she is unable to buy home appliances for her house, because her income is hardly enough to buy food and pay rent.  

Ameena applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy home appliances and a television to use for her house. She hopes that she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy home appliances and a television for her house.

loans.name: Om-Mohammed Group

texts.en:
Om-Mohammed group consists of four hardworking women from Sana`a, Yemen. They have requested a group loan and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Saida is a very active woman from a poor family. Her husband is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover all of the family's needs. Saida would like to buy some home improvement items, but she doesn`t have enough money. She decided to apply for a loan from AMB to buy a washing machine that will allow her to more easily wash her husband's and her children's clothes. Taking this loan will allow her and her family to feel comfortable so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine in order to easily wash her husband's and her children's clothes

loans.name: Akram Group

texts.en:
Akram group consists of four women from AL-Hodeida , Yemen. They are working hard so that they can achieve their goals. Samira, 32 years old, is the leader of the group. She is hardworking and, through effort and dedication, has managed to overcome adversity and get ahead. 

She has been selling sweets in front of her house for two years. She began this business when she felt her husband wasn't able to cover all the expenses of his family.She likes this business because she thinks it offers a good service for her clients. Recently, Samira didn’t have enough money to buy products for her business. She asked for a loan in the amount of YER 30,000 to buy sweets in order to be able to continue her business. She hopes to attract more clients and help her to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy sweets in order to be able to continue her business.

loans.name: Osama Group

texts.en: Osama Group consists four women from Al-Hodeida governorate, Yemen. They are requesting a loan for 120,000 YER. Amal is 30 years old, married, and the leader of the group. Her husband works for many hours every day to cover the expenses of his family. She decided to help him and started a small business. She sells clothes and cosmetics door-to-door, which she has been doing for four years. She wants to buy more clothes and cosmetics to cover the demands of her clients. She is requesting a loan from AMB for 50,000 YER. She looks forward to opening her own clothes store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and cosmetics to cover the demands of her clients.

loans.name: Tahany

texts.en: Tahany is 41 years old, married, and has three children, and is from Sana`a, Yemen. She is a very efficient woman because aside from caring for her family, she likes to work and thus help her family. Her business is selling clothes, which has been her sole source of income for one year. She started her business selling articles of clothing in the market in her area with limited capital. At the present time, her business does not make a big profit due to the difficult situation in Yemen. She is requesting a loan from AMB for 200,000 YER, which she will use to purchase articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, etc. The loan will give her the opportunity to improve the income from her business. In the future, she hopes that all her children will be able to conclude their studies.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Venceremos Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal  Venceremos está conformada por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no cursaron una carrera y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad luchan por brindarle a su familia una mejor estabilidad.

Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Juana y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jabón, huevos, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Venceremos" communal bank is made up of eight members - seven women and one man.  They are all responsible parents with a total of 15 children under their care.  The members are all from the west of Nicaragua and are hard-working, responsible, and have a desire to do better than they have ever done before.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, the group's members did not study at university and needed to work from a young age.  Now, each member of the group is fighting to provide their family with better financial stability.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, the group's coördinator is Juana.  She has a grocery store, where she sells consumable products, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, soap, eggs, and matches, in small quantities.  Juana works twelve hours every day, selling her products from a room in her home. This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock-up her business by buying and selling consumable products.  It is hoped that, in the not-too-distant-future, Juana will be able to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock up her business buying and selling consumable goods such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, soap, eggs, and matches.

loans.name: Madelyn Vanessa

texts.es: Madelyn Vanessa 23 años de edad casada originaria del municipio de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país,se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable con muchos deseos de superación personal.  es una microempresaria que se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva y usada la cual compra en otro municipio del país y distribuidoras mayoristas de Chinandega, además de este negocio ella elabora manualidades las que también ofrece y vende a sus clientes fijos y eventuales que ella tiene, inicia este negocio vendiendo únicamente ropa usada y posteriormente sus clientes le fueron encargando ropa nueva mercadería en la cual fue ampliándose mas pasando el tiempo, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo, para aprovechar la temporada alta de fin de año para lo cual necesito invertir en mercadería nueva y satisfacer pedidos de sus clientes que han aumentado, uno de sus sueños es poder prosperar en su negocio, mejorar sus vivienda para garantizar una buena seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Madelyn Vanessa is 23 years old. She is married and from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She is characterized as an enterprising and responsible woman who really wants to get ahead personally. She is a micro-businesswoman who sells new and used clothing that she buys in another town in the country and from wholesale distributors from Chinandega. In addition to this business, she makes crafts which she also sells to her regular and occasional customers. She started this business just selling used clothing and later her customers ordered new clothing from her. She expanded more over time. The purpose of this loan is to be used for working capital to take advantage of the end of the year season for which she needs to invest in new merchandise and fill orders from her customers that have gone up. One of her dreams is to be able to prosper in her business and improve her home to to guarantee safety for her family.

loans.use: to invest in working capital buying a variety of styles of clothing for children and adults as well as accessories to make her crafts.

loans.name: Satening

texts.fr:
Monsieur Satening, âgé de la soixantaine, adore son métier de bijoutier. Métier qui est exercé par sa famille de générations en générations. Il l’a hérité de son père, qui lui, l’a hérité de son grand père. Quelques outils étaient là mais il a du en renouveler d’autres plus performants pour son travail. C’est aussi l’objet de son crédit afin de pouvoir acheter de la matière première et quelques outils. Il fabrique des bijoux en or et en argent, et possède une clientèle très fidèle car en matière d’or il faut avoir affaire à une personne de confiance.
Satening est marié et père d’une grande famille qu’il nourrit grâce aux revenus de son activité. Il est aidé par ses enfants qui sont ouvriers aussi, ils l’appui dans les charges de la maison.
Il a un rêve, celui de créer une grande entreprise familiale et de se faire connaitre à travers la région de part leur travail bien fait.
texts.en:
Satening, who is in his sixties, adores his trade as a jeweler, a trade which has been carried out by his family, from one generation to another. He inherited it from his father, who in turn inherited it from his grandfather. He has some of the tools for his work but has been obliged to replace others with more performing tools. For this reason he needs a loan so he can buy raw materials and some tools. He makes jewelry with gold and silver and has a very loyal customer base, since as far as gold is concerned it is important to deal with a trustworthy person.

Satening is married and father to a large family, which he is able to feed thanks to the income from his business. He is helped by his children who are also laborers; they help with the household expenses.

He has a dream of creating a large family company and building up a reputation throughout the region for the quality of their work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and small tools for making gold and silver jewelry for resale.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William es un campesino de 39 años de edad, casado y padre de cuatro hijos. Actualmente trabaja como operario en un cultivo de flores y, de manera independiente se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería; pero, con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos familiares decidió asociarse con un gran amigo para montar un taller de mecánica, aprovechando la oportunidad que se les presentó de tomar un local y la ventaja de que su socio es técnico mecánico con amplio conocimiento en la labor. El taller prestará el servicio toda la semana, pero él sólo podrá apoyar la labor los fines de semana, ya que debe cumplir con su horario de trabajo actual. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar equipos y herramientas de trabajo (llaves, juego de copas o dados, destornillador, alicate, pinzas de sujeción, entre otros) y repuestos al por mayor (frenos, bujías, luces, retrovisores, acelerador, entre otros), así podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que generará un nuevo ingreso para el sustento familiar. William sueña con hacer crecer este negocio para independizarse totalmente y generar una estabilidad económica que le permita brindar un mejor bienestar y calidad  de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Thirty-nine-year-old William is a married peasant and a father to four children.  He is a worker on a flower farm and also works as an independent farmer and raising cattle.  However, with a desire to improve his household income, William has decided to partner-up with a good friend in order to open a garage.  They will take advantage of the fact that they have premises which they can easily take on, and of the fact that William's friend is an experienced mechanic.  The garage will be open all week but William will only work for the business at the weekend, due to his current work schedule.  William is applying for this loan in order to buy tools and equipment (spanners, hubcaps, screwdrivers, blocks, wire clipper, pincers, and more) and to buy spare parts in bulk (brakes, lights, spark plugs, rear view mirrors, accelerators, and more).  With all this William can start his own business, which will generate a new income to help support his family.  William dreams of expanding his business so as to be completely independent and have financial stability that will allow him to offer his family better well-being and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment (spanners, hubcaps, screwdrivers, blocks, wire clipper, pincers, and more) and to buy spare parts in bulk (brakes, lights, spark plugs, rear view mirrors, accelerators, and more).

loans.name: Banco Mujer Buscando El Triunfo Group

texts.es: Doña Luz Mery tiene mucho tiempo de pertenecer a Banco Mujer Buscando el Triunfo, es la presidenta del grupo, que está compuesto por 5 socias que invierten el financiamiento en actividades agropecuarias. Esta señora tiene 43 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, 2 cursan la secundaria y uno más en primaria. Su esposo por asuntos de trabajo se ve obligado a pasar más tiempo fuera de la casa, ya que trabaja en construcción y por temporadas debe estar en otras partes del país;  Esto hace que la situación económica de la familia se vea muy afectada, ya que ella debe satisfacer todas la necesidades de sus hijos con los ingresos que le genera su actividad productiva, que es la cría y engorde de cerdos. Este es su quinto préstamos y lo va a invertir en la compra de mas cerdos pequeños, y una cerda para aumentar su producción. El principal deseo de Doña Luz Mery es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, es por eso que ella y su esposo trabajan arduamente.
texts.en:
Doña Luz Mery has been a member of the communal bank “Mujer Buscando el Triunfo” for a long time. She is the group’s president. The group is composed of five members that invest the loans in agriculture. Luz Mery is 43 years old, married and has three underage children; two in secondary school and one in primary school. Her husband does not spend much time at home, due to his job. He works in construction and has to be in other regions of the country during the different working seasons. This results in financial problems for the family since she has to cover their children’s needs with her own activities, i.e. raising pigs.

This is her fifth loan and she will use it to buy more piglets and a sow, looking to increase her production. Her biggest dream is that her children can continue studying and this is why she and her husband continue to work hard.

loans.use: to buy a sow and more piglets.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es soltero, de 35 años, tiene 5 hijos todos menores de edad y estudiantes, el junto a su familia vive en Aldea Los Encuentros, Sololá. Se dedica a la agricultura (cultivo de papa y zanahoria), lleva 20 años en esta labor la cual heredó de sus padres. Realiza está actividad porque le gusta y es la fuente de sus ingresos que utiliza para el sostenimiento sus hijos. 
Además de la agricultura, Manuel también se dedica a la elaboración de artículos de mostacia, de esta actividad obtiene más ingresos que complementan el sustento de su familia. 
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,500.00 para la compra de semilla y fertilizante orgánico y pago de mano de obra para el cultivo de papa. 
Sueña con comprar un terreno y construir su casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is a single 35 year old man. He has 5 children, all minors and in school. He lives with his family in the town of Los Encuentros, Sololá. He works in agriculture (growing potatoes and carrots). He has been doing this work for 20 years and he inherited it from his parents. He does this activity because he likes it and it is the source of the income he uses to support his children.  

In addition to farming, Manuel also makes beaded items. From this activity he obtains more income to supplement his family's support. He is asking for a loan of Q 4,500.00 to buy seeds and organic fertilizer and to pay for labor costs to plant the potatoes. He dreams of buying some land to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer and to pay for labor to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Micheline est  une jeune femme de 30 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants de 3 mois et 6 ans. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 5 ans déjà, elle fait aussi la broderie mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Micheline is a 30-year old married women with two children, who are three months old and six years old respectively. After her training, she opened a small sewing workshop, which has been going well for the past five years. She also does embroidery but does not have the materials to process her orders more rapidly and satisfy her customers on a timely basis. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and small sewing materials (pins, needles, lining, thread...), which will mean she can avoid going to the market all the time and can sew and resell to her customers. The profit she makes from this loan will enable her not only to buy her sewing materials to expand her business but also to satisfy some of her and her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric and small sewing materials.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 23 years old. He is living in an area of Jordan called Rsaifeh with his family of 2 siblings and his parents. Mohammad currently works at a mini market with his brother. He is also pursuing his Bachelor's degree, majoring in accounting. He is in his 2nd year and is planning to find a job in his field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially. Right now his family is facing a financial crisis that is hindering their ability to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr:
Madame Saye, est une femme très brave qui s’active du matin au soir. Elle se lève à 5h du matin pour rentrer à 20h du soir chez elle. Elle est mariée et mère de famille et participe activement à la gestion de son foyer. Elle vend des légumes depuis maintenant 15 ans, elle possède d’ailleurs une cantine dans le marché du village et ravitaille la plupart de ses voisins. 
Elle vient peut être pour la première fois solliciter un crédit mais elle connait le système des prêts car dans l’association dans laquelle elle appartient, elles se faisaient de petits crédits tournantes entre elles. Le prêt lui servira donc à l’achat de sacs de choux, sacs de carottes, sac d’aubergines douces et amères.
Ce que souhaite Saye, c’est d’avoir son propre espace cultural pour l’exploiter elle même et y faire du maraichage. Mais pour cela, elle a besoin d’un appui financier.
texts.en:
Saye is a good, honest woman, who is busy from morning to night. She gets up at five in the morning and comes home at eight in the evening. She married and a mother and contributes actively to the household management. She has been selling vegetables for 15 years now and has a stall in the village market; she also provides supplies for most of her neighbors.

It might be the first time she has requested a loan but she knows how the loan system works as the women in the association to which she belongs
made small revolving loans to each other. This loan will be used to buy sacks of cabbages, carrots, and sweet and bitter aubergines.

Saye would like to have her own farming land to farm products herself and develop a garden marketing acitivty. However, to do this, she will need financial help.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cascarrillo, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobos, agricultura y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de desayunos que los reparte a transportistas, por las noches en su carrito prepara salchipollo para la venta y los fines de semana vende mazamorra y ceviche es una mujer emprendedora es muy conocida por la labor que realiza.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de servicio descartable platos, depósitos, vasos, cubiertos y servilletas para distribuir sus comidas de una manera segura y limpia, generando mayor cliente e ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 48 years old. She lives in the district of Cascarrillo, a rural district of Buenos Aires. It is a community characterized by its locust forests, its farming and ranching. It is two hours from the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells breakfasts that she delivers to drivers. At night in her little cart she makes salchipollo to sell and on weekends she sells mazamorra and ceviche. She is an enterprising woman who is well known for the work she does.  

She has asked for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy disposable products such as plates, containers, cups, cutlery and napkins to deliver her food safely and cleanly, generating more customers and income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy disposable plates, cups, cutlery and napkins.

loans.name: Concepta's Group

texts.en:
Concepta is a member of the Engila Ndala Group in Webuye District.  She is pictured here in a group of 8 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 67 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Concepta has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the left wearing a blue and white blouse.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Concepta is married and has 6 children.  She is 34 years old and is known as being friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Concepta has been a farmer for 13 years. She described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  	

The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Concepta’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2009 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed the family and send children to school.  As an active member in her community, Concepta also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes to lead, wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Concepta plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more profits from harvest, farm training, farm group support, and is able to save money and feed the family.	

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Concepta and the Engila Ndala Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent, 37 years old, would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Umalkhayr Fuad

texts.en: Umulkhayr Fuad, 22 years old, studies at Gollis University College, faculty of civil engineering. She is a junior student and her main challenge is the lack of a laptop to prepare her university assignments. She approached Kaaba Micro finance Institution for a laptop. Kaaba will  provide the laptop, which she can pay for in monthly repayments. After finishing university, Umulkhayr wants to study in the Masters program.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and spices. Nenita is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Inuka Group

texts.en:
Inuka is a Nuru International group of two farmers in the Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Inuka collectively guarantee the loan.
Sophia who is raising up her hand is the leader of this group. She is married with three children. She has been a member of this group for three years now. 
The loan from Kiva will enable her acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer which will enable her to realize a bountiful harvest. Sophia, just like other members of her group will take input loans for one acre. She will grow maize in 1/2 acre, sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. The harvest she gets will ensure food security for her household and she is optimistic she will get a surplus. She plans to sell the surplus and pay school fees for her children. She also plans to save some of the money for emergencies; for instance when any member of the family falls ill, she will be able to take him/her to the hospital for treatment.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en: Because Mervat is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Mervat was born in 1981. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat with her husband. Mervat has been running her own mini-market for 2 years. She is planning to raise her profit and income by including a larger quantity of food products in her mini-market in order to be a good financial support for her family. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add food products.

loans.name: Sura

texts.en: Sura is a 19-year-old lady, who lives with her parents and 5 siblings in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq. She was studying for her Bachelor's degree, majoring in Chemistry. Then she changed her major to Special Education. She is in her 2nd year. She is planning to start her work life after graduation to support her family financially and to improve herself. To do so, she needs to pay for her upcoming semester tuition. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera is a married woman who was born in 1973. She is a mother of 4. Her husband is a retired man who currently works in security. For the past year, Sameera decided to help her husband financially by arranging flowers. She found this profitable and now wants to buy a larger quantity of the needed materials for arranging flowers and by also adding clothes to her sales to raise her profit and help her husband in covering their children's needs. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more flowers and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Basema

texts.en: Basema is a married woman who was born in 1961. She is a mother of 6. Her husband sews clothes. She decided to help her husband financially by selling clothes for the past 3 years and found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes to raise her sales. She also wants to help her husband with his business by buying more fabric that will increase his productivity. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and fabric for her business.

loans.name: Rasmia

texts.en: Rasmia was born in 1972. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband and 8 sons and daughters. Rasmia currently works as a hairdresser and at the same time sells cosmetic products and accessories. She started her business as a result of the financial problems she faced. She first sold a small amount of her products and then she expanded. Now she is planning to buy a larger quantity of accessories and cosmetic products with more variety to them in order to raise her profit. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en: Dalia is a 20-year-old lady, who lives with her retired parents and 4 siblings in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. She is studying for her Bachelor's degree, majoring in House Economy. She is in her 2nd year. She is planning to continue her studies to get her Master's degree. To do so, she needs to pay for her upcoming semester tuition. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 22 years old. He is living in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his family consisting of 4 siblings and his parents. Mohammad was studying for his Bachelor's degree, majoring in Computer Science. Then he changed his major to Economics. He is in his 1st year now and is planning to find a job that suits his field of study after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially. Currently, they are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the quantity of goods that she sells.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal was born in 1960. He is married and a father of 5. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. Jamal has been selling various types of birds such as ducks, chickens and pigeons for 4 years. He is planning to expand his business in the future by building a poultry farm where he can keep his birds. Now he needs to buy food for his birds as well as more pigeons and cages to expand his business. Because he doesn't have enough money to do so, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add more pigeons, chickens and ducks to his business.

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en: Tahani is a 31 year old lady living with her father and 3 siblings in an area of Jordan called Irbid. Her father passed away, and one of her brothers is playing the role of his father by working hard in construction to cover his family's needs. Tahani is studying for her Bachelor's degree, majoring in English language and literature. She is in her 2nd year. She is planning to start working after graduation to support her family financially and to improve herself. To do so, she needs to pay tuition for her upcoming semester. However, she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 20 years old. He is living in an area of Jordan called Mafraq with his family consisting of 3 siblings and his parents. Mahmoud is persuing his Bachelor's degree in Political Science. He is in his 3rd year and is planning to find a job in his field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially. Currently his family is facing a financial crisis that is hindering their ability to pay fees for his upcoming semester. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay fees for his upcoming semester

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
Sabohat, who was born in 1974, is a divorced mother of three children, two of whom are adults. Sabohat has her own business sewing and selling mantras. She began this enterprise five years ago with her own money, and has been steadily developing it.

In order to increase her profits, Sabohat is requesting a loan of 800 USD to buy fabrics and fiber. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and fiber

loans.name: Kholzhamol

texts.en:
Kholzhamol is 43 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. Her partner is a taxi driver. They have 2 children they love very much. They live together in the south part of Tajikistan.

She sells a variety of industrious goods as a bucket, a mop, a kettle, a mixer, etc. She stores her merchandise in a room in her house. She acquires her products in shopping centers in the city.  She began working this way over 4 years ago, because she needed to earn money. Currently, she manages her business alone.  

This is her second loan with IMON, and she is grateful for its financial support in helping her to realize her plans. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy industrious goods for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy industrious goods for her business

loans.name: America (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Susana es otro de los integrantes del grupo América, ella tiene la edad de 42 años, estudio secundaria, es viuda y tiene dos hijos de nombre Esteban de 18 años que estudia la carrera y Rocío de 10 años que estudia la primaria. Ella platica que desde hace más de 12 años se dedica a la venta de comida y antojitos mexicanos, cuando ella inició con su negocio fue con el propósito de ayudar en los gastos de su hogar pero ahora que enviudo tiene que sacar adelante a sus hijos sola, sus ventas de comida las realiza de lunes a viernes, desde su casa prepara comidas y sale a entregar a las oficinas y comercios de la comunidad, también el fin de semana pone un pequeño puesto en la universidad en el cual vende antojitos mexicanos (tostadas, empanadas, gorditas, papas, plátanos frutos) y tortas. 
Ella está muy contenta con su negocio ya que le da la oportunidad de brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y pagar sus estudios. 
Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudará a comprar frijol, arroz, carne, aceite, chile, tomate, cebolla, crema, queso y refrescos para continuar con sus ventas. 
Susana además realiza ventas de zapatos por catálogo en sus tiempos libre para obtener un ingreso extra. 
A futuro le gustaría remontar la construcción de su casa y adaptar un pequeño local en el cual establecer una cocina económica. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son: 
Guadalupe venta de refrescos, Teresa venta de cosméticos, 
María de los Ángeles panadería, María venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Susana, 42, is also a member of group “América”. She finished secondary school, is a widow and has two children: Esteban, who is 18 and goes to the university, and Rocío, who is ten and goes to primary school.

Susana says that she has been selling food and Mexican snacks for more than twelve years. She started this business with the intention to help to cover the home expenses. Now that she became a widow, she has to help her children get ahead on her own. She works Monday to Friday. She prepares the food at home and visits offices and other establishments in her community to sell it. During the weekends, she sells Mexican snacks (tostada [deep fried tortilla], empanadas [stuffed bread], gorditas [stuffed cakes], fries, fruits and sandwiches) in a little stall at the university. She feels very happy with her business, since it helps her to give her family a better quality of life and pay for her children’s studies.

With a loan from VisionFund, she will buy beans, rice, meat, oil, chili, tomatoes, onions, cream, cheese and beverages and continue with her business. She also sells shoes from a catalog during her free time, which represents and extra income for her.

In the future, she would like to continue building her house and open an establishment where she can have a cost-efficient kitchen.

The remaining members are:
Guadalupe, who sells beverages; Teresa, who sells cosmetics; María de los Ángeles, who sells bakery products; and María, who sells tortillas.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, meat, oil, chili, tomatoes, onion, cream, cheese and beverages.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 42 years old, is married and has four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, aged 33, is married and has three children, all attending school. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, Emmanuel wishes to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. Rebecca is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Rebecca has been in this business for 35 years now.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aphrodis

texts.en:
Aphrodis, 49 years old, would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers to increase his production of maize. He plans to reinvest his profits into the business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline sells household consumables such as wheat flour and maize flour from her home to her neighbors, She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

Jackline wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour and cooking oil. She appreciates the support from Kiva and  Yehu at large.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Aminadabu

texts.en:
Aminadabu, a 58-year-old father of six, has been farming for the past 10 years. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers  to increase his production of maize. Aminadabu wishes to reinvest the profits in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is married but has not been blessed with kids. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family.

She has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future as her town has grown for her to meet the demands of the people around.

With the 15,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial supports.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a member of Ngachi Group in Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group-leader farmers. (The field officer is also in the photo, standing on the left). The group leaders represent 51 individual farmers, who are not pictured here. 

Joseph has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative. He is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving a quarter acre of maize and a quarter acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Joseph is married and has eight children. He is 70 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Joseph has been a farmer for 34 years. He describes last year's harvest as excellent but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  

Joseph first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season. He joined One Acre Fund for several reasons: to get the best seed prices as well as fertilizer and hybrid seeds; to learn new farming methods; and to earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. 

Joseph plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for the farmers. His own life was improved because he had more profits from his harvest, more farm training and more group support and was able to save money and feed the family.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Joseph and the Ngachi Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. The organization continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Ali Yusuf

texts.en:
Ali Yusuf, 30 years old, is married and has three children. He is a student at Alpha University College, faculty of Information Technology. Ali also works at Care International. He faces many challenges in both his learning and working.

Ali has requested a loan from Kaaba since he needs a laptop, which he will pay for in monthly repayments. He is now on a waiting list and Kaaba will provide him with the laptop.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Mouhsen

texts.en:
Mouhsen, 36 years old, is an Iraqi client who is married and has 5 children. Mouhsen and his wife provide the family's income together. 

Mouhsen owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2010 and now has a hired employee. Mouhsen has built up good experience in this field. He has an excellent reputation and is becoming well known in the surrounding area.

Mouhsen is requesting a loan of $2,400 in order to install a rolling shutter, a display window and an external ceiling for his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, a display window and an external ceiling for his grocery store

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer is a single lady who was born in 1991. She is living in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her parents and 6 siblings. She decided to help her family financially by selling clothes for the past year and found it profitable. As the winter is coming, now she wants to add selling blankets to her business to increase her profits. This will further help her family in covering their needs. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets for her business.

loans.name: Shahed

texts.en: Shahed is a 19 year old lady living with her parents and 2 brothers in an area of Jordan called Salt. Shahed is persuing her Bachelor's degree majoring in Strategic Studies and International Relations. She is in her second year. She is planning to start working after graduation to support her family financially and to improve herself. To do so, she needs to pay tuition for her upcoming semester. However, she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay fees for her upcoming semester

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en: Jehad is 22 years old. She is living in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her family consisting of 5 siblings and her parents. Jehad is studying for her Bachelor's degree, majoring in Business Administration. She is in her 4th year and is one step closer to graduation. She is planning to find a job that suits her field of study after graduation in order to start supporting her family financially as they are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Abdulkareem

texts.en: Abdulkareem is 22 years old. He is living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his family consisting of 5 siblings and his parents. Abdulkareem is studying for his Bachelor's degree, majoring in Applied Arts and Design. He is in his 3rd year and is planning to find a job that suits his field of study after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en: Because Muna is a conservative woman, she asked her father to take her place in the picture. Muna is a single lady who was born in 1993. She is living in a sector in Jordan called Karak with her parents and 7 siblings. For the past two years, after she finished high school, she has helped her father in running his mini-market. Now she wants to help her father by increasing the inventory in his mini-market with a larger quantity of food products in order to raise his sales and profit. Because he doesn't have enough money to do this himself, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products for her father's business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1989. He is single and lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with his parents. His father works at a governmental entity. Mohammad has been making mosaic art work since childhood. He started his business doing small simple crafts. Then he started to expand it by making his mosaic art on boxes and frames and selling them. He found his business profitable and a good support for his family. Now he wants to rent a store where he can do his work professionally and where he can put his products for sale. Because he doesn't have enough money to do so, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to rent a store for his business.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is a married woman who was born in 1974. She is a mother of 4. For the past year, she has helped her husband financially by selling clothes and accessories and found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of new clothes and accessories to raise her sales to help her husband in covering their children's needs. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en: Ayat was born in 1990. She is married and lives with her husband and her only daughter in a sector in Jordan called Salt. Her husband sells clothes. Ayat has been doing crafts using flowers and arranging flowers in pots for 3 years. She started her business in childhood as a hobby. Now she would like to expand her business to start helping her husband financially. She needs to buy tools and more flowers.  Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy flowers and the needed tools for her business.

loans.name: Ban Le - D4A1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan, 36, is married and has two children. She and her husband are farmers. Their income mainly relies on cultivating rice, which doesn't satisfy their everyday needs despite their hard work. Notwithstanding her financial difficulties, she sends her children to school. One is studying in medical school and the other is in 7th grade.

Mrs. Loan is opening a grocery store selling beer and confectionaries. This business will help augment her income from farming and breeding to cover her family's living expenses and her children's tuition fees. However, she lacks enough capital to start her store, so she applied for a loan from the Anh Chi Em program to realize her business plan. 

People in her village give her family many compliments for their hard work (her husband works extra for local construction employers) and about their dutiful children. She hopes that through her commercial activities she can earn more money for her family and improve their living conditions.

Mrs. Loan is the team leader of Ban Le - D4A1 Group, which consists of 12 Thai ladies. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to open a grocery store to sell beer and confectioneries

loans.name: Mamayakub

texts.en:
Mamayakub, 42 years old, is married and has 2 children. Being a responsible father, he works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs and send some of his children to school.  Mamayakub is dedicated to his farming business, growing rice on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards, he has worked hard from early morning till late evening, for the past 5 years.

Mamayakub would like to develop his business, so he is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Thim is 31 years old, married and a loving father of two school-aged children. He and his wife are raising their family in Bakan district, Pursat by doing farming and selling chopped firewood. This couple aims to educate their children at a higher level and wants them to be professional in the future, so they work hard to earn enough to support them with everything they need.

With the purpose of getting the family ahead and have comfortable living conditions, Thim is asking for a loan to build a safe latrine for the household. The water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate has helped to encourage Thim to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of his family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build a safe latrine for the household

loans.name: Husaeen

texts.en:
Husaeen, 24 years old, lives with his parents in Nour Shams refugee camp. This Palestinian refugee camp in Tulkarm was founded in 1951.

Husaeen’s family has a shortage of money to do some work in their house. He has applied to Ryada for a loan to help his family improve the house by repairing the windows and the doors. Husaeen said that this loan will help him a lot and he is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair his house's windows and doors

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the spare parts and accessories of her Jeepney. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her children who are both in grade school. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of their Jeepney. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and their children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rowena dreams to buy another jeepney and hire a driver. She hopes that her family will have a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members each week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her Jeepney.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 56, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Andres, a farmer, and they have children. Rose and her husband manage their household while operating the business. Rose works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Rose operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rose earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Rose earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rose is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. 

Rose dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her family will have better living conditions.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Philister is married and has three school going children. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Philister has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors.

With the loan of 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 50 years of age, is from Iraq. He is married and has six children. Ahmad and three of his children provide the family income while the rest continue their studies.

Ahmad owns an upholstery business. He specializes in making pillows and beds. Ahmad established his business in 2008 and now has an employee. He has built good experience in this field. He has an excellent reputation and is well known in the surrounding area. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan of $2,400 to buy a specialized piece of equipment for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a specialized piece of equipment for his work

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Msasani is a Nuru International group of three farmers in Kuria West District. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Msasani collectively guarantee the loan.
Getangita (raising his hand in the photo) has been a member of this group for two years now.  He is 32 years old, married with two children. During the 2014 long rains, he plans to grow maize, sorghum and millet in ½ an acre and ¼ each respectively. He is therefore requesting for a loan from KIVA to enable him purchase farm inputs. The produce from his farm will be sufficient food for his family and he will sell the surplus and invest the money in a business to supplement income to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Zakaria's Group

texts.en:
Zakaria’s group has 5 group leader farmers and is located in Matete District.
